Cannot be opened in instanced areas such as dungeons, PvP areas, or raids.

name: Marmot Meat

name: Mutton Loin

desc: A lean piece of meat taken from under the short ribs of a dodo.

name: Mole Meat
desc: A fist-sized chunk of lean, bloody meat cleanly sliced from the carcass of a pesky mole.

name: Young Dodo Roaster
desc: A whole young dodo, small enough to fit in most conventional household ovens.

name: Chicken Breast
desc: A tender piece of meat taken from the breast of a chicken.

name: Antelope Shank
desc: A tough piece of meat taken from the upper leg of an antelope.

name: Aldgoat Chuck
desc: A large, tender slab of meat taken from the shoulder of an aldgoat.

name: Raptor Shank
desc: An extra-lean, tough piece of meat taken from the leg of a raptor.

name: Buffalo Sirloin
desc: A cut of tender, lean meat taken from the rear back of a buffalo.

name: Eft Tail
desc: Sinewy meat taken from the tail of an eft.

name: Orobon Liver
desc: The soft liver of a deepwater orobon.

name: Megalocrab Leg
desc: A fat megalocrab leg, bursting with sweet, juicy meat.

name: Chicken Egg
desc: The egg of a domesticated chicken.

name: Dodo Egg
desc: The heavy egg of a wild dodo.

name: Puk Egg
desc: The lightweight egg of a puk.

name: Apkallu Egg
desc: The large egg of a wild apkallu.

name: Malm Kelp
desc: This dark green variety of seaweed found in all five of Eorzea's seas has been known to grow up to a malm in length.

name: Wild Onion
desc: A pungent bulb vegetable native to the Near East.

name: Coerthan Carrot
desc: A long orange root vegetable commonly grown in the rocky alpine soil of the Coerthas region.

name: Ogre Pumpkin
desc: A bright-orange squash which sweetens in flavor when cooked.

name: Ruby Tomato
desc: Though many botanists claim this tangy blood red specimen is more closely related to a fruit than a vegetable, it is widely accepted across Eorzea as the latter.

name: Alpine Parsnip
desc: A long white root vegetable indigenous to the mountainous region of Coerthas.

name: La Noscean Lettuce
desc: A crisp leafy vegetable native to the plains of La Noscea.

name: Cieldalaes Spinach
desc: An iron-rich leafy vegetable native to the Cieldalaes.

name: Highland Parsley
desc: Oft used as a garnish in other dishes, this pungent vegetable grows in abundance in the mountainous region of upper La Noscea.

name: Paprika
desc: A pepper which can be dried and ground to make a mild red spice. It is often used in medicines, as well as in cooking.

name: Nopales
desc: An edible oval-leaved cactus brought back by explorers of the New World.

name: Popoto
desc: A starchy tuberous vegetable originally introduced to Eorzea by explorers from the distant western continent.

name: Wizard Eggplant
desc: A firm purple-skinned vegetable indigenous to the mountains of the Near East. A common wives' tale claims if you eat too many of this vegetable, you will turn into one.

name: Midland Cabbage
desc: A round leafy vegetable which prefers the steady climate of the Black Shroud.

name: Aloe
desc: A thick spiny-leaved cactus indigenous to the southern continent of Meracydia. The Miqo'te are known to treat severe burns with the cool gel-like substance found inside the leaves.

name: Salt Leek
desc: A long, pungent, leafy vegetable that lacks a bulb like that of its cousin, the onion.

name: Ramhorn Zucchini
desc: This long, thin variety of squash earns its name from its resemblance to the horn of a mountain ram.

name: Maiden Artichoke
desc: The leaf-like bud of an artichoke plant. Due to the roughness of its petals, only the fleshy lower portions can be consumed, as well as the center of the bud, commonly known as the “heart.”

name: Shriekshroom
desc: The underdeveloped sporeling of a funguar.

name: Chanterelle
desc: An edible mushroom known for its leaf-like appearance as well as its fruit-like fragrance.

name: Gil Bun
desc: This tiny round mushroom has a cap which resembles a coin, and is known for its rich flavor and pungent aroma.

name: Button Mushroom
desc: A small white mushroom commonly found in moist areas across Eorzea.

name: White Truffle
desc: A rare white mushroom that grows in the soil, rather than above it, making the specimen almost impossible to locate. It is treasured as a delicacy for its unique aroma.

name: Black Truffle
desc: A rare black mushroom that grows in the soil, rather than above it, making the specimen almost impossible to locate. It is treasured as a delicacy for its unique aroma.

name: Kukuru Bean
desc: This seed of the kukuru tree is the primary ingredient in chocolate.

name: Cinderfoot Olive
desc: The seed of an olive tree, often preserved in brine or pressed to make oil.

name: Gridanian Chestnut
desc: The seed of a chestnut tree, this savory nut is covered in a coat of prickly spikes.

name: Gridanian Walnut
desc: The seed of a walnut tree, this fragrant nut is covered by a thin, fleshy outer shell and a hard inner shell.

name: Iron Acorn
desc: The seed of an oak tree, this small nut is covered by an extremely hard outer shell.

name: Lowland Grapes
desc:
A semisweet variety of grape which has adapted to the volcanic soil abundant on Vylbrand.

name: Buffalo Beans
desc: A common variety of green bean recognizable by its long thin pods. Buffalo are said to be fond of the beans, and have been known to eat entire crops if left unchecked.

name: Sticky Rice
desc: This grain is imported from a land far to the east. When cooked, it has a consistency slightly more glutinous than normal rice.

name: Lalafellin Lentil
desc: Thin round beans resembling tiny convex lenses. Thought to have been introduced to Eorzea by the realm's first Lalafellin settlers.

name: Millioncorn
desc: Hundreds of sweet yellow kernels adorn each cob of this vegetable native to the recently discovered New World.

name: Jade Peas
desc: Sweet green beans recognizable by their thin, crescent-shaped pods.

name: Rye
desc: A dark variety of rye grass commonly found growing in the higher elevations of Mor Dhona and Coerthas.

name: Sunset Wheat
desc: A common variety of golden-brown wheat eaten as a staple in many of Eorzea's city–states.

name: Rye Flour
desc: Coarsely milled rye.

name: Sunset Wheat Flour
desc: Finely milled sunset wheat.

name: Cornmeal
desc: Coarsely milled millioncorn.

name: Cinnamon
desc: The sweet-smelling bark of the cinnamon tree is often dried and ground into a spice used to add flavor to confectionaries, though it is also commonly used in medicines.

name: Garlean Garlic
desc: A pungent spice used to flavor many different varieties of dishes. It is also thought to ward off vampiric bats, but there is no evidence to substantiate that claim.

name: Black Pepper
desc: An aromatic spice used in cooking as well as pickling.

name: Cloves
desc: A sweet-smelling spice made from the dried buds of the clove tree. It is used to flavor confectionaries, and as an essential oil.

name: Marjoram
desc: A sweet-smelling herb used in cooking and in medicines.

name: Vanilla Beans
desc: A sweet-smelling spice made from the dried pod of the rare vanilla plant. It is often used in the making confectionaries as well as medicines.

name: Galago Mint
desc: A leafy herb with a crisp, fragrant aroma. It is often used in cooking and in teas, as well as for its essential oil.

name: Ala Mhigan Mustard
desc: When dried and ground into a fine powder, this yellow-tinged spice can add quite the kick to any dish.

name: Pearl Ginger
desc: An exotic root vegetable native to the Far East that is often dried, ground, and used in cooking as well as in the creation of medicines.

name: Midland Basil
desc: A fragrant herb used to flavor various meat and poultry dishes.

name: Dragon Pepper
desc: A red-hot spice known to cause severe burns in the mouths of those who consume too many.

name: Laurel
desc: A savory spice made from the dried leaves of the laurel bush, or as it is known by some, the yanny bush.

name: Mugwort
desc: The young leaves of the mugwort plant are used not only as a spice in cooking, but also as a curative agent in various unguents.

name: Thyme
desc: A fragrant herb used to flavor various meat and poultry dishes.

name: Almonds
desc: A tear-shaped nut which can be used to season exotic sweets, or pressed for its fragrant oil.

name: Desert Saffron
desc: This spice made from the dried styles of the desert saffron flower gives a bright-yellow color to dishes.

name: Nutmeg
desc: A sweet-smelling seed that is ground into a powder and used to flavor pastries and tea. It is also widely used in Far Eastern medicines.

name: Sagolii Sage
desc: A savory herb often found growing in parched desert environments. It is used in cooking and various medicinal ointments and unguents.

name: Thanalan Tea Leaves
desc: These leaves, when dried and steeped in hot water, create a sweet-smelling tea known for its curative properties.

name: Table Salt
desc: Finely ground salt used not only for flavoring foods, but for pickling and preserving as well.

name: Maple Sugar
desc: Crystallized sugar made from boiling down maple syrup.

name: Maple Syrup
desc: A sweet, dark liquid made by boiling down maple sap.

name: Honey
desc: Bees make this sweet golden honey from the nectar of flowers.

name: Sweet Cream
desc: The butterfat-rich layer skimmed off of buffalo milk. Widely used in confectionaries.

name: Smooth Butter
desc: A smooth, fatty cream made by churning buffalo milk.

name: Kukuru Butter
desc: A thick oil extracted from kukuru beans. Used in making chocolate.

name: Kukuru Powder
desc: Roasted kukuru beans ground into a fine powder. Used in making chocolate.

name: Clove Oil
desc: Clove-infused cooking oil.

name: Olive Oil
desc: A fragrant light-green oil extracted from pressed olives.

name: Lavender Oil
desc: Lavender-infused cooking oil.

name: Cider Vinegar
desc: A fruity vinegar made from fermenting faerie apples.

name: Dark Vinegar
desc: A high-quality distilled vinegar made from select lowland grapes.

name: Pie Dough
desc: Simple pie dough made of flour and butter.

name: Sour Red
desc: Made from lowland grapes grown on arid soil, this vinegary wine is more suited to cooking than it is to drinking (though that does little to stop most Lominsan pirates from drowning their sorrows in the phenolic seepage).

name: Gelatin
desc: A clear gelling agent extracted from animal skin and fish bones.

name: Fish Stock
desc: Broth created from boiling down the flesh and bones of various types of seafood.

name: Tomato Sauce
desc: A tangy sauce made from crushed tomatoes.

name: Dodo Stuffing
desc: A mixture of dried bread, nuts, and fruit, blended with several savory spices.

name: Chicken Stock
desc: A clear golden broth made by boiling chicken bones.

name: Gysahl Greens
desc:
A leafy vegetable indigenous to the Near East. While too bitter for most people's tastes, chocobos are known to enjoy the flavor, and thus the greens are often used as fodder for the animals.

F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by offering multiple servings)

name: Lominsan Anchovy
desc: These small saltwater fish form massive schools resembling colossal sea creatures to discourage predators from approaching.

name: Finger Shrimp
desc: A common saltwater shrimp found in the plankton-rich waters of the Sea of Jade.

name: Coral Butterfly
desc:
A colorful saltwater fish commonly found in the warm seas around the island of Bianaq. Not known for its flavor, the wavekin is most often kept as a pet.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]

name: Tiger Cod
desc:
A striped saltwater fish indigenous to the cold northern waters of the Bloodbrine Sea.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 1 and higher.]

name: Helmet Crab
desc: This saltwater wavekin, most commonly found in the shallows of the Strait of Merlthor, is protected by a hard shell resembling a helmet.

name: Rothlyt Oyster
desc: Also known as the milk of the sea, these tasty bivalve mollusks can be found on sea rocks all around Eorzea, but it is said the plumpest, most succulent grow in the nutrient-rich waters of the Rothlyt Sound.

name: Navigator's Dagger
desc: These thin, long saltwater fish will oft jump out of the water and glide for yalms across the surface, using their pectoral fins as ersatz wings.

name: Razor Clam
desc: A long bivalved mollusk most commonly found buried in the beaches of islands situated in the Rhotano Sea. They are known to leap out of their burrows when surprised or agitated.

name: Blowfish
desc:
A saltwater fish that, when provoked, blows up to three times its normal size to intimidate the would-be attacker. It is also known to have an organ which contains a potent silencing poison.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]

name: Bianaq Bream
desc: A cherry-colored saltwater fish found in abundance in all of Eorzea's five seas, though it is said those caught near Bianaq are the largest.

name: Black Sole
desc: A flat bottom-feeder commonly found in the frigid waters of the Bloodbrine Sea.

name: Hammerhead Shark
desc:
A ravenous shark with a hammer-shaped head it uses to quickly detect its prey. This wavekin is most commonly found living in small schools in the Strait of Merlthor.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]

name: Indigo Herring
desc:
This blue-backed, white-bellied saltwater fish native to the Indigo Deep is known to migrate in large schools from north to south in the winter, and back again in the summer.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]

name: Ash Tuna
desc: A large saltwater fish known to migrate between the Sea of Jade and the Sea of Ash. In recent years, overfishing by boats from the Far East has led to a significant drop in their numbers.

name: Fullmoon Sardine
desc:
A tiny saltwater fish native to the waters of Vylbrand. Unlike other wavekin, they feed only at night, their activity increasing as Menphina waxes.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]

name: Haraldr Haddock
desc: A tasty saltwater fish indigenous to the cold waters of the Bloodbrine Sea. Its name comes from a legendary northern king who it was said would only eat the fatty flesh of this wavekin.

name: Whitelip Oyster
desc: A bivalved mollusk found on the cliffs and rocks lining the Rhotano Sea. On rare occasions, sand will become trapped inside the shell and gradually form into a pearl.

name: Silver Shark
desc:
A large, spindle-shaped shark commonly found in the Sea of Ash and known to attack without provocation.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]

name: Raincaller
desc:
A deep-blue freshwater fish native to the lakes and swamps of the Black Shroud. They can be seen sticking their heads out of the water whenever it rains, leading people to believe it is the fish summoning the storm. However, naturalists have surmised that the fish are simply rising to the surface in search of food, mistaking the drops of water for insects.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]

name: Rock Lobster
desc: A large crimson crustacean commonly found hiding in the rocks off the shores of islands dotting the Rhotano Sea. The rich, flavorful tails are regarded as a delicacy across Eorzea.

name: Mahi-Mahi
desc: This deep-sea predator is not only massive, but deceptively fast. Some sailors swear that a mahi-mahi can make the journey from Meracydia to the Cieldalaes in less than a fortnight, though knowing most sailors, that claim may be slightly exaggerated.

name: Mazlaya Marlin
desc:
A large saltwater fish found in the warm waters south of the Sea of Ash and known for its remarkable swimming speed.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]

name: Megalodon
desc:
A legendary shark with a mouth so big and an appetite so large, it is said it can swallow an adult Roegadyn whole.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 4 and higher.]

name: Crayfish
desc: A brown-carapaced freshwater crustacean commonly found in the rivers and lakes of Aldenard.

name: Princess Trout
desc: Unlike other freshwater trout which make their habitat in swift-flowing rivers, the silver princess trout prefers the relative seclusion of inland lakes.

name: Dusk Goby
desc: A hardy species, the dusk goby can survive not only in freshwater, but also the mouths of rivers, where the tides can bring saltwater malms inland.

name: Pipira
desc: A fierce freshwater fish most commonly found in Gridania's Jadeite Flood and Black Tea Brook.

name: Crimson Crayfish
desc: A crimson-carapaced freshwater crustacean commonly found in the streams and lakes of Vylbrand.

name: Brass Loach
desc: This long, thin, brass-colored freshwater fish is most commonly found in the Yafaem Saltmoor and surrounding rivers and lakes.

name: Maiden Carp
desc: Large schools of these dark silver fish can be found in the White Maiden and her tributaries.

name: Bluebell Salmon
desc: Hatched far up inland rivers, bluebell salmon will travel all the way downstream to the Indigo Deep where they will spend the majority of their adulthood. Then, however, when it comes time to spawn, they will return back upstream to the place of their birth.

name: Warmwater Trout
desc: This freshwater fish was once found only in the waters heated by the flows of lava coursing beneath the mighty volcano O'Ghomoro. After the Calamity, however, fishers began finding the wavekin in other warm locations such as Thanalan.

name: Black Eel
desc: Black eels reach maturity in the Sea of Jade, at which point they return back up the Velodyna and Hathoeva rivers to spawn.

name: Dark Bass
desc:
This freshwater fish, known for its voracious appetite, is originally native to the southern continent of Meracydia.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]

name: Yugr'am Salmon
desc: This freshwater fish matures in the salty waters of the Bloodbrine Sea, only to return up the Yugr'am River where it was born to spawn.

name: Velodyna Carp
desc: This scarlet cousin to the maiden carp can most commonly be found in the Velodyna and Hathoeva rivers.

name: Northern Pike
desc: Though classified as a freshwater fish native to the White Maiden, this particular wavekin can survive in the brackish waters where the Maiden meets the Strait of Merlthor.

name: Giant Catfish
desc: A giant freshwater fish found throughout Aldenard and known for the decidedly feline whiskers which it uses to detect the movement of prey.

name: Emperor Fish
desc:
This giant freshwater fish lives out its adulthood feeding in the Indigo Deep before returning all the way back up to the head of the White Maiden to spawn.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]

name: Takitaro
desc: A legendary giant freshwater fish indigenous to the lands of the Far East. The takitaro found in Eorzea are thought to be the offspring of a specimen presented as a gift to an eccentric sultan who loosed the fish into a cenote when it grew too large to keep in the royal aquariums.

name: Cloud Cutter
desc: The swiftest inhabitants of the Sea of Clouds, cloud cutters will fly straight in a single direction for malms before quickly turning at some unthinkable angle and darting off in another direction.

name: Allagan Snail
desc: A giant snail believed to have been bred for consumption during the reign of the Great Allagan Empire.

name: Tree Toad
desc: A giant green toad found in nearly all of the lakes and swamps of Aldenard.

name: Dart Frog
desc: This tiny frog found in the swamps and lakes of the Black Shroud secretes a powerful poison known to induce paralysis.

name: Lava Toad
desc: This giant red toad, native to the swamps of Vylbrand but now found throughout Aldenard, earns its name from the red firerock which once spewed forth from the now-dormant volcano, O'Ghomoro.

desc: Liquid metal widely utilized by alchemists in the production of firesand and by smiths in the production of alloys.

name: Vitriol
desc: A strong, viscous acid known to corrode almost any metal.

name: Effervescent Water
desc: Naturally sparkling water bottled at the source.

name: Beastkin Blood
desc: The warm blood of a beast. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.

name: Scalekin Blood
desc: The cold blood of a scaled creature. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.

name: Spoken Blood
desc: The warm blood of a bipedal sentient. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.

name: Viscous Secretions
desc: The viscous secretions of a slug.

name: Acidic Secretions
desc: The acidic secretions of a sea hare.

name: Formic Acid
desc: The pungent and corrosive secretion of an antling.

name: Maple Sap
desc: An odorless and colorless liquid extracted from maple trees. Can be boiled down to make sweet maple sugar.

name: Treant Sap
desc: The lifeblood of a living tree.

name: Potash
desc: A mixture of plant ashes soaked in distilled water.

name: Lime Sulphur
desc: An alchemical compound made by boiling a mixture of powdered limestone and sulphur.

name: Animal Glue
desc: An adhesive substance created by boiling down the hides of various animals.

name: Fish Glue
desc: An adhesive substance created by boiling down various parts of fish and other wavekin.

name: Horn Glue
desc: An adhesive substance created by boiling down horns.

name: Void Glue
desc: A powerful adhesive created by boiling down the flesh of various voidsent.

name: Wing Glue
desc: An adhesive substance created by boiling down the leathery wings of bats, wyverns, and imps.

name: Scale Glue
desc: An adhesive substance created by boiling down the hard scales of peistes and dragons.

name: Latex
desc: The milky sap of a mature tree.

name: Rubber
desc: Pliable rubber made from latex.

name: Clear Glass Lens
desc: A hard flat lens made of uncolored glass.

name: Potter's Clay
desc: Thick, sticky clay used to make cups, pots, and jars.

name: Humus
desc: Nutrient-rich soil consisting of decaying leaves.

name: Beeswax
desc: Fragrant yellow wax created by melting down beehives.

name: Beehive Chip
desc: The nest of a honeybee, comprised of several hundred hexagonal chambers made of a waxy substance secreted by the vilekin.

name: Lanolin
desc: A waxy yellow substance extracted from sheep wool and used in ointments as well as to prevent rusting.

name: Rock Salt
desc: A large chunk of naturally occurring salt crystals. It is often ground into fine grains before being used to flavor and preserve food.

name: Cinnabar
desc: This red mineral is used to create quicksilver, as well as potent sedatives.

name: Saltpeter
desc: A translucent crystalline substance often used in making glass, firesand, and dyes.

name: Natron
desc: A white powder used in alchemy as a deodorizer and leavening agent.

name: Silex
desc: A pure white sand made up of finely ground silica.

name: Alumen
desc: A white mineral used by leatherworkers to tan animal hides. It also has deodorizing properties.

name: Black Alumen
desc: A darker variety of the mineral used by leatherworkers to tan animal hides. It lacks the deodorizing properties of its lighter counterpart.

name: Grenade Ash
desc: Dark grey ash produced by the internal combustions of a grenade.

name: Brimstone
desc: A natural sulphur occurring in volcanic regions around Eorzea.

name: Bomb Ash
desc: Grey ash produced by the internal combustions of a bomb.

name: Coke
desc: A hot-burning fuel created by destructively distilling raw coal.

name: Animal Fat
desc: The foul-smelling fatty tissue of a beastkin.

name: Hardened Sap
desc: A partially congealed ball of sticky tree sap.

name: Garlean Rubber
desc: A lightweight rubber far more elastic than the common variety found in Eorzea.

name: Tinolqa Mistletoe
desc: A variety of parasitic plant that is commonly found growing on trees in the Black Shroud.

name: Matron's Mistletoe
desc: This variety of parasitic plant is named after the goddess Nophica as it appears to embrace the trees on which it grows.

name: Mistletoe
desc: A poisonous, parasitic plant which survives by attaching itself to other larger plants. It is often gathered and put on display during regional winter festivals.

name: Thavnairian Mistletoe
desc: A variety of parasitic plant that is commonly found growing on the stout acacia trees of Thavnair. The inhabitants of Thavnair's capital city of Radz–at–Han have a strange custom that states if two people meet underneath a sprig of mistletoe, they must each give the other one of their shoes.

name: Yellow Ginseng
desc: A Far Eastern root used in various medicines.

name: Lavender
desc: A fragrant purple flower found growing in coastal areas throughout Aldenard.

name: Carnation
desc: A beautiful red flower often planted in public gardens or picked and put on display in houses. Large plantations of carnations can be found in and around Gridania.

name: Belladonna
desc: A beautiful flower common in Aldenard from which a potent sleeping poison can be extracted.

name: Chamomile
desc: A fragrant yellow flower found growing throughout Vylbrand.

name: Mandrake
desc: The man-shaped root of a wild plant commonly found growing on Vylbrand.

name: Lamp Marimo
desc: A rare type of luminescent moss found on the bottom of lakes and in caves. Slight currents cause the moss to form into a ball as it grows.

name: Trillium
desc: A beautiful, white, tripetaloid flower.

name: Trillium Bulb
desc: If planted and tended with loving care, this bulb should grow into a lovely trillium plant.

name: Vampire Plant
desc: This rare variety of parasitic plant is known to suck the lifeblood from all flora with which it comes in contact.

name: Red Landtrap Leaf
desc: The thin, twitching leaf of a roseling.

name: Blue Landtrap Leaf
desc: The thin, twitching leaf of a flytrap.

name: Puk Wing
desc: The membranous wing of a puk. Often carried by young Lalafellin girls as a good-luck charm.

name: Bat Wing
desc: The leathery wing of a bat.

name: Imp Wing
desc: The membranous wing of an imp.

name: Ahriman Wing
desc: The large, veined wing of an ahriman.

name: Morbol Vine
desc: The squirming vine of a morbol.

name: Ochu Vine
desc: The thick, leathery vine of an ochu.

name: Jellyfish Cnida
desc: The poison-producing spines of a jellyfish.

name: Jellyfish Umbrella
desc: The soft, gelatinous body of a jellyfish.

name: Pudding Flesh
desc: A foul-smelling, gelatinous mass taken from a pudding.

name: Moor Leech
desc: A bloodsucking leech. Used by barbers, chirurgeons, and chymists alike to drain the tainted humours from an ill patient.

name: Grass Viper
desc: A deadly snake common in grasslands across Eorzea. Its venom is known to contain a potent bleeding poison.

name: Tarantula
desc: A deadly forest spider from whose venom can be extracted a potent silencing poison.

name: White Scorpion
desc: A rare albino scorpion, thought to be an ill omen by the early Dunesfolk tribes.

name: Black Scorpion
desc: A deadly desert vilekin from whose venom can be extracted a potent paralyzing poison.

name: Bloody Lance Head
desc: A blood-encrusted lance head found lodged in the thick hide of a great buffalo.

name: Bloody Bardiche Head
desc: A blood-encrusted bardiche head found lodged in the thick hide of a great buffalo.

name: Bloody Cesti Covers
desc: Blood-soaked cesti covers retrieved from the site of a gruesome battle.

name: Bloody Bow Rim
desc: A bloodstained wooden bow rim retrieved from the site of a gruesome battle.

name: Bloody Grimoire Binding
desc: A blood-soaked leather grimoire cover retrieved from the site of a gruesome battle.

name: Mailbreaker Blade
desc: A sturdy darksteel blade used in the creation of mailbreakers.

name: Avenger Grips
desc: A pair of tempered darksteel grips used in making avengers.

name: Rampager Head
desc: A double-edged darksteel axe head used in the creation of rampagers.

name: Obelisk Head
desc: A narrow darksteel head used in the creation of obelisks.

name: Sarnga Limb
desc: A flexible bow limb carved from spruce used in the creation of Sarnga.

name: Suspended Trillium Flower
desc: A trillium flower, preserved via alchemical agents. Used in the creation of trillium canes.

name: Astrolabe Clinometer
desc: An astrally charged clinometer used in the creation of astrolabes.

name: Vanya Silk Hat Lining
desc: A large piece of vanya silk cloth used to line a hat.

name: Vanya Silk Robe Lining
desc: A large piece of vanya silk cloth used to line a robe.

name: Vanya Silk Glove Lining
desc: A large piece of vanya silk cloth used to line gloves.

name: Vanya Silk Crakow Lining
desc: A large piece of vanya silk cloth used to line crakows.

name: Gryphonskin Shoulder Guards
desc: Pieces of hippogryph leather padding used on body armor to provide extra protection to the shoulders.

name: Gryphonskin Shin Guards
desc: Pieces of hippogryph leather padding used on foot armor to provide extra protection to the shins.

name: Gryphonskin Elbow Pads
desc: Pieces of hippogryph leather padding used on hand armor to provide extra protection to the elbows.

name: Gryphonskin Knee Pads
desc: Pieces of hippogryph leather padding used on leg armor to provide extra protection to the knees.

name: Darksteel Breastplate
desc: A darksteel breastplate, usually coupled with a matching backplate and worn over another piece of body armor, completing the set.

name: Darksteel Gauntlet Plates
desc: A pair of darksteel plates used in the construction of gauntlets.

name: Darksteel Couters
desc: Darksteel elbowguards used in the creation of heavy armor.

name: Rose Gold Clasps
desc: Tiny rose gold clasps used to secure earrings to the wearer's ear.

name: Tiny Crown
desc: A tiny golden crown used to decorate pastries.

name: Terebinth
desc: This foul-smelling sap can be used to remove dyes quickly and easily. Remember to always use in a well-ventilated area.

name: Wine Red Dye
desc: A labor-saving red dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

name: Sky Blue Dye
desc: A labor-saving blue dye, used for coloring anything from cloth to metal.

name: Blue Pigment
desc: Extracted from natural sources, this blue powder can be prepared to create a plethora of colorful dyes.

name: Red Pigment
desc: Extracted from natural sources, this red powder can be prepared to create a plethora of colorful dyes.

name: Yellow Pigment
desc: Extracted from natural sources, this yellow powder can be prepared to create a plethora of colorful dyes.

name: Grey Pigment
desc: Extracted from natural sources, this grey powder can be prepared to create a plethora of colorful dyes.

name: Brown Pigment
desc: Extracted from natural sources, this brown powder can be prepared to create a plethora of colorful dyes.

name: Green Pigment
desc: Extracted from natural sources, this green powder can be prepared to create a plethora of colorful dyes.

name: Purple Pigment
desc: Extracted from natural sources, this purple powder can be prepared to create a plethora of colorful dyes.

name: Tallow Candle
desc: A stout candle made from sheep fat.

name: Beeswax Candle
desc: A stout candle made from hardened beeswax.

name: Cherry Bomb
desc:
Summons a miniature recreation of a voidsent bomb, created via the thaumaturgical rendering of umbrally charged aetherial energy. Guaranteed never to self-destruct, or your gil back.

Use item to acquire the cherry bomb minion.

name: Noble Grapes
desc: Lowland grapes crossbred over generations to produce maximum sweetness. Their bitter skin makes them unsuitable for eating off the vine, and they are better consumed as juice or wine.

name: Mirror Apple
desc:
A sweet yet sour variety of apples native to Coerthas. When polished, the skins become so shiny it is said one can see their own reflection in them.

(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Honey Lemon
desc:
This rare type of lemon native to the continent of Othard is so sweet, it can be eaten raw.

(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Dzemael Tomato
desc: A rare crossbreed of ruby tomato developed and perfected by House Dzemael botanists.

name: Night Milk
desc:
Rich and creamy buffalo milk harvested immediately before the beast falls asleep.

name: Coeurl Meat
desc: A bloody strip of extra-lean coeurl meat.

name: Cooking Sherry
desc: Fine Lominsan white wine fortified with grape spirit to increase alcohol content and improve its aroma, making it perfect for a variety of culinary dishes.

name: Volcanic Rock Salt
desc: The red hue of this rock salt is said to come from the volcanic soil of O'Ghomoro.

name: Filtered Water
desc: Water purified using a complex method of passing it through several layers of charcoal and rock.

name: Voidsent Blood
desc: The bubbling blood of a voidsent. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.

name: Behemoth Horn
desc: This giant sable horn is prized by furniture makers across the realm.

name: Ifrit's Horn
desc: Torn from the head of the Lord of the Inferno himself, this night-black horn is still hot to the touch.

name: Inferno Horn
desc: Torn from the head of the Lord of the Inferno himself, this night-black horn pulses with uncontrollably powerful fire-aspected energies.

name: Garuda's Feather
desc: Ripped from the wings of the Lady of the Vortex herself, this feather generates a powerful gust each time it is waved.

name: Vortex Feather
desc: Ripped from the wings of the Lady of the Vortex herself, this feather pulses with uncontrollably powerful wind-aspected energies.

name: Titan's Heart
desc: Drawn forth from the chest of the Lord of Crags himself, this small stone weighs more than a grown Lalafell.

name: Crag Heart
desc: Drawn forth from the chest of the Lord of Crags himself, this small stone pulses with uncontrollably powerful earth-aspected energies.

name: Odin's Mantle
desc: Removed from the back of the elder primal Odin, this heavy mantle is fit for a god.

name: Morbol Seedling
desc:
For the nonce, his breath is the worst of your problems.

Use item to acquire the morbol seedling minion.

name: ADS Plating
desc: A piece of darksteel plating retrieved from an Allagan automated defense system node.

name: ADS Frame
desc: A piece of darksteel framework retrieved from an Allagan automated defense system node.

name: ADS Illuminant
desc: A glowing orb retrieved from an Allagan automated defense system node.

name: Glade Pendant Lamp
desc: A pendant lamp designed to complement glade residences.

name: Campfire
desc: Share scary stories with your comrades over this authentic campfire.

name: Stump Stool
desc: Simplicity never goes out of style.

name: Firewood
desc: Nothing exudes bucolic charm like a stack of firewood.

name: Riviera Armchair
desc: A padded armchair designed in the riviera style.

name: Walnut Dining Table
desc: A simple dining table crafted from walnut.

name: Manor Fireplace
desc: A haunting fireplace custom-made for Haukke Manor.

name: Glade Lantern
desc: A small lantern designed in the glade style.

name: Ink & Quill
desc: Write the night away with this feather quill and ink pot set.

name: Stuffed Moogle
desc: He can't change your class, retrieve items from your delivery box, or manage your belongings, but he is cuddly.

name: Eorzean Map
desc: The map of Eorzea as charted by the famous explorer and cartographer Roddard Ironheart.

name: Dimension Blade Fragment
desc: A fragment of the Dimension Blade, Phlegethon's fell scimitar.

name: Moggle Mog XII's Whisker
desc: This regal whisker once belonged to Good King Moggle Mog, Twelfth of His Name.

name: Granite
desc: An extremely hard rock said to be formed of cooled magma.

name: Cut Stone
desc: A rectangular slab of stone commonly used in building construction.

name: Marble
desc: A chunk of marble with mesmerizing mottlings and streaks.

name: Bloodgrass
desc: A bundle of dried bloodgrass stalks for use in thatching.

name: Maiden Grass
desc: A bundle of dried maiden grass stalks for use in thatching.

name: Firebricks
desc: Rectangular clay bricks that have been hardened through firing and can withstand intense heat.

name: Clinker Bricks
desc: Partially vitrified bricks favored for their superior hardness and durability.

name: Roof Tile
desc: A flat roof tile made of baked clay.

name: Mortar
desc: A mixture used in construction to bond bricks or stones.

name: Varnish
desc: A coating used to protect wooden surfaces and give them a clear and shiny finish.

name: Iron Nails
desc: Iron nails used in crafting and construction.

name: Steel Nails
desc: Steel nails used in crafting and construction.

name: Cobalt Nails
desc: Cobalt nails used in crafting and construction.

name: Iron Joint Plate
desc: A plate of beaten iron used in crafting and construction.

name: Steel Joint Plate
desc: A plate of beaten steel used in crafting and construction.

name: Cobalt Joint Plate
desc: A plate of beaten cobalt used in crafting and construction.

name: Steel Hinge
desc: A steel hinge used for installing doors.

name: Cotton Canvas
desc: A roll of sturdy canvas woven from cotton.

name: Linen Canvas
desc: A roll of sturdy canvas woven from linen.

name: Felt Lining
desc: A roll of woolen felt used as insulation in building construction.

name: Sylphic Silk
desc: A roll of fine silk made with traditional sylphic weaving methods.

name: Island Seedling
desc: A seedling that grows in the wilderness of Vylbrand.

name: Shroud Seedling
desc: A seedling that grows in the wilderness of the Black Shroud.

name: Desert Seedling
desc: A seedling that grows in the wilderness of Thanalan.

name: Lotus Leaf
desc: A lotus leaf grown to immense size, suitable for keeping the sun and the rain at bay.

name: Ishgardian Steel Ingot
desc: A unique alloy made with traditional Ishgardian smelting methods.

name: Carnivorous Seedling
desc: A seedling that grows in the suffocating confines of the Aurum Vale.

name: Dungeon Seedling
desc: A seedling that grows in the dank depths of the Thousand Maws of Toto–Rak.

name: Seagrot Water
desc: Brackish water taken from the Sastasha Seagrot.

name: Amdapori Stone
desc: A stone slab used by the ancient Amdapori in building construction.

name: Fine Wax
desc: Superior-quality wax used in the maintenance of furnishings at Haukke Manor.

name: Nymian Orb
desc: A magicked light-giving orb used by the long-lost Nymian civilization.

name: Belah'dian Glass
desc: A round pane of glass excavated from ancient Belah'dian ruins.

name: Blue Fox Hide
desc: The hide of a blue fox, prized in wintry regions for its warmth. Can be used to make garments and furnishings.

name: Chinchilla Hide
desc: The unblemished hide of a chinchilla, prized in wintry regions for its warmth. Can be used to make garments and furnishings.

name: Ahriman Tears
desc: Large teardrops harvested from an ahriman.

name: Exquisite Buttons
desc: Lovingly handcrafted antique buttons.

name: Morbol Saliva
desc: Watery secretions harvested from the mouth of a morbol. Smells as foul as it sounds.

name: Cutting Oil
desc: A lubricant used in the working of metal.

name: Frosted Glass Lens
desc: A hard flat lens made of opaque glass.

name: Stuffed Ahriman
desc: Although it doesn't fly, its petrifying gaze is certain to keep would-be burglars at bay.

name: White Raven Armor Fragment
desc: A fragment of the armor worn by Legatus Nael van Darnus of the Garlean Empire.

name: Stone Vigil Lumber
desc: Sturdy lumber scavenged from the Stone Vigil.

name: Leviathan's Barb
desc: Wrenched from the maw of the Lord of the Whorl himself, this razor-sharp barb is constantly slick with brine.

name: Barb of the Whorl
desc: Wrenched from the maw of the Lord of the Whorl himself, this razor-sharp barb churns with the unbridled power of the sea.

name: Kingly Whisker
desc: This whisker, imbued with the majesty of all moogle monarchs past and present, once belonged to Good King Moggle Mog, Twelfth of His Name.

name: Mossy Stone Sword
desc: A sword crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

name: Mossy Stone Axe
desc: An axe crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

name: Mossy Stone Claws
desc: A pair of claws crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

name: Mossy Stone Spear
desc: A spear crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

name: Mossy Stone Bow
desc: A bow crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

name: Mossy Stone Staff
desc: A staff crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

name: Mossy Stone Rod
desc: A rod crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

name: Weathered Tome
desc: This weathered tome appears to have been a magical grimoire in a previous life.

name: Faded Tome
desc: This faded tome appears to have been a magical grimoire in a previous life.

name: Ferberite
desc: A jet black mineral with alluring luster.

name: Native Gold
desc: A high-purity, naturally occurring nugget of gold.

name: Scarlet Sap
desc: Its color reminiscent of blood, this sap is used in the working of aged lumber.

name: Shroud Tea Leaves
desc: Picked from plants that grow wild in the Black Shroud, these leaves are extremely bitter and are not ideal for brewing tea.

name: Apricot
desc:
A variety of stone fruit borne over from the Near East. Its orange flesh is at once sweet and tart.

name: La Noscean Leek
desc: A rare variety of leek, typically harvested young for a milder flavor.

name: Young Cieldalaes Spinach
desc: This bunch of Cieldalaes spinach has been picked young to reduce bitterness.

name: Blood Orange
desc:
A rare variety of orange grown in La Noscea, named for its unusual red flesh.

name: Petrified Log
desc: The passage of time has turned this log into stone.

name: Scheelite
desc: A mysterious ore that glows intermittently.

name: Raziqsand
desc: Discovered by a Far Eastern alchemist, this powder is used to harden gold.

name: Saurian Skin
desc: The rare hide of a saurian.

name: Cashmere Fleece
desc: Lustrous white wool sheared from a species of mountain goat prized for its fleece.

name: Emery
desc: Powderized garnet used in the polishing of gemstones.

name: Star Anise
desc: Originating from the Far East, this fragrant spice is shaped like eight-pointed stars.

name: Dalamud Popoto
desc: Hailing also from the western continent, this cousin to the common popoto is lurid red in color.

name: Royal Kukuru Bean
desc: A king among kukuru bean varieties, prized for its high nutritional value.

name: Canard Breast
desc: A tender piece of meat taken from the breast of a farm-fattened duck.

name: Ancient Lumber
desc: A length of lumber obtained by processing a petrified log.

name: Wolfram Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted wolfram.

name: Saurian Leather
desc: A large piece of cured saurian skin.

name: Cashmere Cloth
desc: Several yalms of cashmere cloth wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

name: Spruce Plywood
desc: A thin but sturdy construction material made by pressing together layers of wood, designed to achieve uniform strength.

name: Darksteel Hook
desc: A hook masterfully wrought from darksteel.

name: Darksteel Wire
desc: A roll of wire painstakingly drawn out from darksteel.

name: Rose Gold Cog
desc: A cog masterfully wrought from rose gold.

name: Gryphonskin Strap
desc: A continuous strap of leather painstakingly wrought from gryphonskin.

name: Silver Brocade
desc: A luxurious fabric woven from silver thread, featuring raised patterns.

name: Spirits of Salt
desc: A potent acid with myriad applications.

name: Spicy Tomato Relish
desc: A zesty Near Eastern relish made by stewing tomatoes with select spices and seasoning.

name: Diluted Vitriol
desc: A flask of vitriol diluted with pure water.

name: Clear Prism
desc: An uncolored, transparent prism used in the crafting of a glamour prism.

name: La Noscean Lettuce Seeds
desc: La Noscean lettuce seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

name: Millioncorn Seeds
desc: Millioncorn kernels suitable for garden cultivation.

name: Umbrella Fig Seeds
desc: Umbrella fig seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

name: Halone Gerbera
desc: A flowering ornamental plant said to be beloved of Halone, the Fury.

name: Azeyma Rose
desc: A flowering ornamental plant said to be beloved of Azeyma, the Warden.

name: Nymeia Lily
desc: A flowering ornamental plant said to be beloved of Nymeia, the Spinner.

name: Dress Material
desc: Pre-cut linen used in the sewing of a spring dress.

name: Mariner Cotton Cloth
desc: Favored by sailors, this bundle of cotton cloth is resistant to wrinkles even when wet.

name: Umbrella Fig
desc: An ornamental plant native to the islands of the south seas, given its name by Lalafellin clans who used its prodigious leaves in lieu of umbrellas.

name: Jute
desc: Native to the islands of the south seas, the fibrous stem of this plant can be used to weave cloth.

name: Glazenut
desc: The oil extracted from this nut is ideal for use as varnish.

name: Broombush
desc: The dried stalks of this hardy shrub are commonly used in the making of brooms.

name: Jute Yarn
desc: Light yarn spun from jute.

name: Light Steel Plate
desc: A sheet of hammered light steel.

name: Taffeta Cloth
desc: A soft and effulgent cloth originating from the southern lands.

name: Tawny Latex
desc: Tawny in color, this rare variety of latex is yielded only by specific trees.

name: Terminus Putty
desc: A powerful adhesive invented by Master Severian of the Alchemists' Guild, so named for being the putty to end all putty.

name: Manor Varnish
desc: Used extensively at Haukke Manor, this varnish enhances the acoustic properties of musical instruments.

name: Curiel Root
desc:
A parsnip-like tuber found growing on the windswept islands of the northern seas. While too bitter for most people's tastes, chocobos are known to enjoy the flavor, and thus the root is often used as fodder for the animals.

Increases EXP earned by your chocobo companion.

name: Sylkis Bud
desc:
An artichoke-like flower found growing on a majority of the Cieldalaes. While too bitter for most people's tastes, chocobos are known to enjoy the flavor, and thus the meaty buds are often used as fodder for the animals.

Increases your chocobo companion's attack potency.

name: Mimett Gourd
desc:
A large fleshy squash brought back from the New World by Lominsan explorers. While too sweet for most people's tastes, chocobos are known to enjoy the flavor, and thus the gourds are often used as fodder for the animals.

Increases your chocobo companion's healing magic potency.

name: Tantalplant
desc:
A vibrant purple vegetable commonly found growing in the Near East. While too bitter for most people's tastes, chocobos are known to enjoy the flavor, and thus these aubergines are often used as fodder for the animals.

Increases your chocobo companion's maximum HP.

name: Pahsana Fruit
desc:
A bright-red tomato-like fruit brought back from the New World by Lominsan explorers. While too tangy for most people's tastes, chocobos are known to enjoy the flavor, and thus the fruits are often used as fodder for the animals.

Increases your chocobo companion's enmity.

name: Worm of Nym
desc: A king among jade eels, and lord of the Bronze Lake shallows.

name: Aetherlouse
desc: The recent discovery of this vilekin-like denizen of the deep has given rise to fantastical theories that all land-dwelling creatures on Hydaelyn may once have come from the seas.

name: Stuffed Goblin
desc: All attempts to remove the mask of this goblin replica have failed, so do not even consider trying it yourself.

name: Cast-iron Cookpot
desc: A blackened pot perfect for hanging over a cookfire.

name: Throne Gem
desc: A brilliant bauble pried from the Emperor Xande's colossal seat of rule.

name: Levin Orb
desc: A sphere of lightning-aspected energies encased in a transparent receptacle of hyperfused silica.

name: Large Levin Orb
desc: A perfect sphere of overcharged lightning-aspected energies encased in a transparent receptacle of hyperfused silica.

name: Rush Grass
desc: A durable sweet-smelling grass native to the Far East and used in the weaving of baskets and floor mats.

name: Young Water Lily
desc: A unique type of flora which grows on inland ponds, its round, flat leaves creating a floating canopy on the water's surface.

name: Pearl Roselle
desc: A milky white flower commonly found growing in the humid climes of the southern seas.

name: Waterfowl Feather
desc: Unlike those of tree-dwelling cloudkin, waterfowl feathers are exceptional at trapping in heat while keeping out water.

name: Floss Silk
desc: Silk that has been spun into lightweight balls that bear the appearance of cotton.

name: Mist Silk
desc: Each strand of mist silk is twice as thin as regular silk, making it much more difficult to work with.

name: Waterproof Cotton Cloth
desc: This soft cloth has been treated with a thin layer of resin to repel water.

name: Polarized Glass
desc: Glass treated with a complex alchemical concoction to reduce glare.

name: Wolfram Square
desc: A thin, tiny plate of hammered wolfram.

Materials required to craft components for an airship's bladder envelope.

※Only for use in Ixal beast tribe quests.

Materials required to craft components for reinforcing an airship's bladder envelope.

※Only for use in Ixal beast tribe quests.
