name: Battlecraft Demimateria I
desc: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an article of weaponry or armor by its maker during the crafting process.

name: Battlecraft Demimateria II
desc: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an article of weaponry or armor by its maker during the crafting process.

name: Battlecraft Demimateria III
desc: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an article of weaponry or armor by its maker during the crafting process.

name: Fieldcraft Demimateria I
desc: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to a tool by its maker during the crafting process.

name: Fieldcraft Demimateria II
desc: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to a tool by its maker during the crafting process.

name: Fieldcraft Demimateria III
desc: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to a tool by its maker during the crafting process.

name: Demimateria of the Inferno
desc: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an article of weaponry or armor by the Lord of the Inferno during its creation.

name: Demimateria of the Vortex
desc: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an article of weaponry or armor by the Lady of the Vortex during its creation.

name: Demimateria of Crags
desc: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an article of weaponry or armor by the Lord of Crags during its creation.

name: Demimog Demimateria
desc: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an article of weaponry or armor by the Good King Moggle Mog XII during its creation.

name: Mastercraft Demimateria
desc: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an article of weaponry or armor by its exceptionally skilled maker during the crafting process.

name: Onion Prince Seeds
desc: Onion Prince seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

name: Eggplant Knight Seeds
desc: Eggplant Knight seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

name: Garlic Jester Seeds
desc: Garlic Jester seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

name: Tomato King Seeds
desc: Tomato King seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

name: Mandragora Queen Seeds
desc: Mandragora Queen seeds suitable for garden cultivation.

name: Adventurers' Guild Aduyses
desc: A semi-complete collection of notices and timetables, warnings and wanted posters, found in Eorzea's many Adventurers' Guilds.

name: Quick-hardening Sealant
desc: A powerful adhesive developed and used by the Ehcatl Nine.

name: Xelphatol Spring Water
desc: Slightly effervescent water bottled at a spring located deep in the heart of the Ixali homeland, Xelphatol. It has a light-blue tint and a distinctly metallic flavor.

name: Wootz Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted wootz alloy.

name: Platinum Nugget
desc: A small nugget of impure platinum.

name: Platinum Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted platinum.

name: Kirimu Leather
desc: A large piece of cured skin from the chimerical monstrosity Kirimu.

name: Arachne Velveteen
desc: Thick cloth woven from the web of the chimerical monstrosity Arachne.

name: Allagan Wootz Nugget
desc: A small chunk of the alloy used by the Allagan Empire to craft heavy armor.

name: Allagan Leather
desc: A large piece of treated chimerical leather used by the Allagan Empire to craft light armor.

name: Allagan Silk
desc: A spool of thick chimerical silk used by the Allagan Empire to craft mage robes.

name: Borax
desc: This soft lusterless crystal is believed to stay the hands of corruption and is used in the preservation of organics.

name: Arachne Web
desc: The wire-like web of the Allagan chimerical miscreation, Arachne.

name: Wootz Ore
desc: A decent-sized piece of rock containing naturally occurring wootz alloy.

name: Raziqsap
desc: Developed by a Far Eastern alchemist, this powder is used to harden platinum.

name: Dubbin
desc: A greasy mixture of wax, oil, and tallow used for waterproofing and softening leather, while helping maintain its luster.

name: Smoked Bacon
desc: A large side of boar, cured and then smoked. It is widely accepted across Eorzea that “everything goes better” with this flavorful meat.

name: Roasted Coffee Beans
desc: Seeds harvested from the coffee plants which grow in volcanic mountainous soils, and then slow-roasted over an indirect flame for several bells to remove bitterness and bring out flavor.

name: Enchanted Platinum Ink
desc: Ink fortified with platinum sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

name: Bloody Knife Blades
desc: A pair of blood-soaked blades retrieved from the site of a gruesome battle.

name: Mossy Stone Daggers
desc: A pair of daggers crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. They are so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

name: Allagan Catalyst
desc: Dubbed a “god in the machina” by those who first discovered it, modern scholars have yet to discover not only what the catalytic agent contains, but exactly how it functions, understanding only that the substance is required to strengthen the properties of certain materials.

name: Ice Tear
desc: A glass-like shard retrieved from the fallen Lady of Frost.

name: Diamond Tear
desc: A glass-like shard retrieved from the fallen Lady of Frost. It pulses with uncontrollably powerful ice-aspected energies.

name: Syrcus Shard
desc: A remarkably transparent piece of Syrcus Tower's outer wall.

name: Burning Auricle
desc: A crystallized fragment of the dreadwyrm Bahamut's burning heart.

name: Misericorde Blades
desc: Deadly darksteel blades used in the creation of misericordes.

name: Cypress Log
desc: A rough-cut log of cypress timber.

name: Pumice
desc: Volcanic rock riddled with countless tiny holes which make the stone remarkably lighter than it appears. Parchment makers rub the pieces on vellum to prepare the pages for receiving ink.

name: Belah'dian Silver
desc: Discovered buried deep within Belah'dian ruins, this surprisingly heat-resistant silver appears to have been tempered using a technique now lost to modern goldsmiths.

name: Aged Eye of Fire
desc: A stone sphere elementally aspected to fire. A good polishing will be required to restore it to its former luster.

name: Aged Spear Shaft
desc: Seasoned over countless years of use, this worn shaft may no longer be suitable for use in battle, but it will most definitely burn nicely in a fire.

name: Aged Mortar Pieces
desc: A beautiful mortar that has, unfortunately, been split into several pieces. It is, however, not beyond repair─a testament to the skill of the original crafter.

name: Aged Pestle Pieces
desc: A beautiful pestle that has, unfortunately, been split into several pieces. It is, however, not beyond repair─a testament to the skill of the original crafter.

name: Aged Vellum
desc: A single sheet of what appears to be magicked uterine vellum torn from a quire bound within an ancient tome.

name: Dried Ether
desc: Dry, flaky residue found at the bottom of a bottle of evaporated ether.

name: Vintage Cooking Sherry
desc: Fine Lominsan white wine fortified with grape spirit and allowed to mature to the point of perfection, though the flavor may be too strong for weaker palates.

name: Stained Cloth
desc: A beautiful piece of cloth that appears to have been dragged through the mud, dipped in sheep offal, and then forgotten in a latrine.

name: Pine Bonsai
desc: While some view this traditional Doman gardening technique as naught more than a reflection of man's arrogance in believing nature can be bent to his will, most simply find it a beautiful and calming form of art.

name: Splintered Chest
desc: This chest, rumored to have once been stored aboard the Haar─the flagship of the dread pirate Mistbeard─appears to have been not-so-gently pried open with a headsman's axe.

name: Wild Banana Shoot
desc: Under the proper conditions, this seedling will grow into a tree almost ten fulms high, and produce upwards of four score bananas per season.

name: Black Limestone
desc: When polished, this rare form of limestone closely resembles marble.

name: Virgin Basilisk Egg
desc: While all eggs a basilisk lays contain traces of rare ore, the first egg laid in life is thought to contain the highest concentration, making it highly sought after by potion mixers and alchemists.

name: Little Worm
desc: While commonly used as bait by fishers across the realm, little worms also make fine chocobo feed, providing a good source of protein for growing birds.

name: Gregarious Worm
desc: A rare form of earthworm, these fat invertebrates also make fine chocobo feed, providing an excellent source of protein for growing birds.

name: Rosemary
desc: A savory herb treasured for its ability to enhance focus and concentration.

name: Yafaem Wildgrass
desc: After gysahl greens, there's no other verdure a race chocobo would rather sink its beak into.

name: Mazlaya Greens
desc: Once found growing all across the island of Mazlaya, this bright-green plant was almost completely wiped out when chocobos brought to the island by farmers devoured nearly every one they could find.

name: Unaspected Crystal
desc: For reasons unknown to you, this crystal has completely lost its elemental charge.

name: Urushi
desc: Made from the caustic sap of lacquer trees native to the Far East, urushi is used to protect wood by giving it a hard, glossy finish.

name: Composite Whetstone
desc: A heavy whetstone that appears to be man-made, rather than carved from naturally occurring rock.

name: Heat-resistant Plaster
desc: Due to its heat-resistant properties, this plaster is oft used to create molds for metalworking.

name: Clear Fluorite
desc: A rare form of fluorite completely devoid of any interior flaws.

name: Lampblack Linseed Oil
desc: Linseed oil mixed with soot collected from oil lamps to give it a deep-black color.

name: Camel Hair
desc: Thick, brown hair of a Near Eastern monstrosity known as the camel. Dubious reports from sailors claim the beast stands thrice as high as a chocobo, can speak the tongues of man, and has massive humps upon its back which may contain water, wine, or even gold.

name: Black Cinnabar
desc: A form of cinnabar known to contain traces of quicksilver.

name: Duck Bones
desc: It is an oft-forgotten fact that Frandelont Raimdelle, famed naturalist, father of modern taxonomy, and author of the Raimdelle Codex, tried multiple times (without success) to classify the common duck─most obviously a cloudkin─as a spoken, believing their incessant quackings to be a highly developed language beyond the comprehension of mankind.

name: Dark Matter Cluster
desc: This substance of unknown origin has the faculty to assimilate with other forms of matter, effectively restoring them to their original condition. Pieces this large are quite rare.

name: Grade 6 Dark Matter
desc:
It has recently been discovered that this substance of unknown origin has the faculty to assimilate with other forms of matter, effectively restoring them to their original condition. This specific grade of dark matter has been shown to bond best with precisely crafted items made from superior-quality materials.

[Used to repair equipment for levels 1-60.]

name: Red Moko Grass
desc: A less-common variety of moko grass found growing predominantly in the northern mountainous regions of Aldenard.

name: Cassia Log
desc: A rough-cut log of cassia timber. The sweet scent of its bark invokes memories of sweet buns and apple pie.

name: Chemically Treated Chimera Hide
desc: The durability of this chimera hide has been enhanced using aetherochemical compounds formulated thousands of summers ago in an Allagan laboratorium.

name: Raw Celestine
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be celestine─a light-blue crystal that is often added to alloys.

name: Vivianite
desc: A smoke-blue iron-rich ore often found growing within the fossilized bones of long-dead wavekin.

name: Deep-red Crystal
desc: A vividly colored crystal aspected to multiple elements.

name: Deep-red Cluster
desc: A vividly colored cluster of crystals aspected to multiple elements.

name: Deep-green Crystal
desc: A vividly colored crystal aspected to multiple elements.

name: Deep-green Cluster
desc: A vividly colored cluster of crystals aspected to multiple elements.

name: Deep-blue Crystal
desc: A vividly colored crystal aspected to multiple elements.

name: Deep-blue Cluster
desc: A vividly colored cluster of crystals aspected to multiple elements.

name: Farreach Canvas
desc: Originally conceived by inhabitants of the sparsely settled Farreach to withstand the gale-force winds ceaselessly blowing on the Bloodbrine Sea, this rugged sailcloth is one of few materials suited to air travel.

name: Cassia Lumber
desc: Processed cassia lumber. Even with its bark removed, the wood still harbors a faint sweet scent.

name: High Allagan Chimera Leather
desc: A large piece of specially treated chimerical leather used by the Allagan Empire to craft high armor.

name: Gordian Gear
desc: A round cog removed from Alexander's Gordias sector.

name: Large Gordian Gear
desc: A large round cog removed from Alexander's Gordias sector.

name: Bismarck's Baleen
desc: Pulled from the Lord of the Mists's massive maw, this thick piece of keratinized tissue appears aspected to both wind and water.

name: Expanse Baleen
desc: Pulled from the Lord of the Mists's massive maw, this thick piece of keratinized tissue bristles with the power of the endless skies.

name: Ravana's Forewing
desc: Plucked from the Lord of the Hive's back, this remarkably light wing is impossible to tear despite its thinness.

name: Hive Forewing
desc: Plucked from the Lord of the Hive's back, this remarkably light wing pulses with uncontrollably powerful aetherial energies.

name: Mythrite Nugget
desc: A small nugget of impure mythrite.

name: Mythrite Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted mythrite.

name: Hardsilver Nugget
desc: A small nugget of impure hardsilver.

name: Hardsilver Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted hardsilver.

name: Aurum Regis Nugget
desc: A small nugget of impure aurum regis.

name: Aurum Regis Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted aurum regis.

name: Titanium Nugget
desc: A small nugget of impure titanium.

name: Titanium Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted titanium.

name: Adamantite Nugget
desc: A small nugget of impure adamantite.

name: Adamantite Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted adamantite.

name: Mythrite Rivets
desc: Short mythrite pins with large heads. Used in connecting metal plates.

name: Titanium Rivets
desc: Short titanium pins with large heads. Used in connecting metal plates.

name: Adamantite Rivets
desc: Short adamantite pins with large heads. Used in connecting metal plates.

name: Mythrite Sand
desc: Glowing sand consisting of tiny grains of mythrite.

name: Hardsilver Sand
desc: Oily sand containing tiny grains of hardsilver.

name: Aurum Regis Sand
desc: Violet sand containing tiny grains of aurum regis.

name: Mythrite Ore
desc: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the rare metal mythrite.

name: Hardsilver Ore
desc: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the rare alchemic metal hardsilver.

name: Aurum Regis Ore
desc: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the rare metal aurum regis.

name: Titanium Ore
desc: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the rare metal titanium.

name: Adamantite Ore
desc: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the rare metal adamantite.

name: Cloud Mica
desc: A decent-sized chunk of rock made up of what appears to be thousands of thin sheets of silver crystal compacted together into a single mass.

name: Sun Mica
desc: A decent-sized chunk of rock made up of what appears to be thousands of thin sheets of golden crystal compacted together into a single mass.

name: Larimar
desc: A sky-blue jewel.

name: Tiger's Eye
desc: A golden-brown jewel consisting of many colored layers. When polished, it resembles the eye of a tiger─a legendary beast believed to be the ancestor of the coeurl.

name: Agate
desc: A cloudy pink jewel consisting of many colored layers.

name: Star Ruby
desc: A red jewel that has been shaped and polished instead of faceted, creating the illusion of a six-pointed star within the stone.

name: Star Sapphire
desc: A blue jewel that has been shaped and polished instead of faceted, creating the illusion of a six-pointed star within the stone.

name: Opal
desc: A milky white jewel that, depending on the angle at which it is held, will exhibit a rainbow of color within the stone.

name: Citrine
desc: A yellow jewel almost identical to topaz, but several times softer.

name: Chrysolite
desc: A green jewel.

name: Mormorion
desc: A smoky black jewel.

name: Carnelian
desc: A translucent red jewel. Its relative softness makes it easy to carve, and it has been used by royalty throughout history for signet rings.

name: Raw Larimar
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be larimar.

name: Raw Tiger's Eye
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be tiger's eye.

name: Raw Agate
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be agate.

name: Raw Star Ruby
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be star ruby.

name: Raw Star Sapphire
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be star sapphire.

name: Raw Opal
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be opal.

name: Raw Citrine
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be citrine.

name: Raw Chrysolite
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be chrysolite.

name: Raw Mormorion
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be mormorion.

name: Raw Carnelian
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be carnelian.

name: Cloud Mica Whetstone
desc: A whetstone carved from cloud mica. Used for sharpening metal or stone blades.

name: Archaeornis Leather
desc: A large piece of cured archaeornis skin.

name: Wyvern Leather
desc: A large piece of cured wyvern skin.

name: Dhalmel Leather
desc: A large piece of cured dhalmel hide.

name: Dragon Leather
desc: A large piece of cured dragon skin.

name: Amphiptere Leather
desc: A large piece of cured amphiptere skin.

name: Griffin Leather
desc: A large piece of cured griffin hide.

name: Archaeornis Skin
desc: The tough hide of an archaeornis.

name: Wyvern Skin
desc: The coarse hide of a wyvern.

name: Dhalmel Hide
desc: The smooth hide of a dhalmel.

name: Dragon Skin
desc: The thick scaly hide of a dragon.

name: Amphiptere Skin
desc: The slick glossy hide of an amphiptere.

name: Griffin Hide
desc: The leonine hide of a griffin.

name: Bearskin
desc: The thick bushy hide of a bear.

name: Yeti Fang
desc: The curved canine of a Coerthan yeti. You shudder to think how many throats were ripped open by this nail-like tooth.

name: Dragon Fang
desc: The rapier-like fang of an ancient dragon. Some naturalists believe that the age of a dragon can be determined by horizontally slicing its tooth and counting the rings within.

name: Griffin Talon
desc: The sharp curved talon of a griffin.

name: Dark Chestnut Log
desc: A rough-cut log of dark chestnut timber.

name: Birch Log
desc: A rough-cut log of birch lumber.

name: Holy Cedar Lumber
desc: Processed cedar lumber purified with holy water.

name: Dark Chestnut Lumber
desc: Processed dark chestnut lumber.

name: Hallowed Chestnut Lumber
desc: Processed dark chestnut lumber purified with hallowed water.

name: Birch Lumber
desc: Processed birch lumber.

name: Astral Birch Lumber
desc: Processed birch lumber treated so that its elemental aspect tips towards astral.

name: Dark Chestnut Branch
desc: The thick branch of a dark chestnut tree.

name: Birch Branch
desc: The thin branch of a birch tree.

name: Wattle Bark
desc: This bark, when boiled down, produces large amounts of tannin─a substance used by leatherworkers to tan hides.

name: Rainbow Cloth
desc: Several yalms of undyed rainbow cloth wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

name: Holy Rainbow Cloth
desc: Several yalms of rainbow cloth purified with holy water and wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

name: Ramie Cloth
desc: Several yalms of undyed ramie cloth wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

name: Hallowed Ramie Cloth
desc: Several yalms of ramie cloth purified with holy water and wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

name: Chimerical Felt
desc: Several yalms of soft undyed felt created by matting down several layers of hair taken from chimera manes.

name: Astral Silk
desc: Several yalms of silk treated so that its elemental aspect would tip slightly towards astral.

name: Rainbow Thread
desc: Multicolored yarn spun from rainbow cotton.

name: Ramie Thread
desc: Strong, absorbent yarn spun from ramie.

name: Crawler Silk
desc: Silk gathered from crawler cocoons and spun into a thin lustrous thread.

name: Rainbow Cotton Boll
desc: A rare variety of cotton which produces fibers that change color depending on the angle at which light strikes them.

name: Stalk of Ramie
desc: A variety of swift-growing grass native to the Near East. The stalks can be dried and processed into thin threads which, when spun together, can be woven into a cloth not unlike hemp.

name: Chimera Mane
desc: The bristly mane of a biologically engineered monstrosity.

name: Crawler Cocoon
desc: The sticky cocoon of a giant crawler.

name: Enchanted Mythrite Ink
desc: Ink fortified with mythrite sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

name: Enchanted Hardsilver Ink
desc: Ink fortified with hardsilver sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

name: Enchanted Aurum Regis Ink
desc: Ink fortified with aurum regis sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

name: Holy Water
desc: Water blessed by an anointed Halonic Orthodox priest. Used to exorcise most evil spirits from worldly items.

name: Hallowed Water
desc: Water blessed by an anointed Halonic Orthodox priest. Used to exorcise evil spirits from worldly items.

name: Astral Oil
desc: Refined oil with an unbalanced elemental aspect tipping towards astral.

name: Growth Formula Epsilon
desc: This alchemically formulated potation accelerates the growth of foliage.

name: Growth Formula Zeta
desc: This alchemically formulated potation accelerates the growth of foliage.

name: Bear Fat
desc: This musky all-purpose oil is commonly used in tinctures as well as lamps.

name: Crystal Glass
desc: This exceptionally transparent glass does not actually contain any crystal, but earns its name for being as clear as crystallized aether.

name: Black Firesand
desc: A higher concentration of saltpeter makes this flammable powder slightly more explosive than normal firesand.

name: Grade 1 Strength Dissolvent
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to strength, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 1 Dexterity Dissolvent
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to dexterity, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 1 Vitality Dissolvent
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to vitality, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 1 Intelligence Dissolvent
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to intelligence, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 1 Mind Dissolvent
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to mind, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 2 Strength Dissolvent
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to strength, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 2 Dexterity Dissolvent
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to dexterity, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 2 Vitality Dissolvent
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to vitality, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 2 Intelligence Dissolvent
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to intelligence, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 2 Mind Dissolvent
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to mind, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Dragon Scale
desc: This rock-hard scale can withstand the blow of a Roegadyn-wielded battleaxe.

name: Deepeye Tears
desc: It would take at least twenty tears shed from a heartbroken Lalafellin maiden to equal the liquid volume of one deepeye tear.

name: Dhalmel Saliva
desc: The odor of dhalmel saliva has been likened to that of the bloated corpse of a blue cheese artisan drowned in a Grand Company camp latrine and left to sit in the hot sun for a sennight.

name: Dragon Blood
desc: Most likely the blood of a dragon. For some unknown reason, the humours will not coagulate.

name: Dravanian Spring Water
desc: Clear water taken from a spring in the foothills of Abalathia's Spine.

name: Abalathian Spring Water
desc: Clear water taken from a spring on one of the many islets floating above Abalathia's Spine.

name: Skyspring Water
desc: Crystal-clear water taken from a secluded spring located on a remote islet floating above the Sea of Clouds.

name: Seventh Heaven
desc: A rare flower that has an elemental aspect tipped severely in the direction of astral.

name: Gelato Flesh
desc: A quivering gelatinous lump of voidsent flesh neither cold nor sweet. Consumption is not recommended, even during times of starvation.

name: Wyvern Wing
desc: The thick leathery wing of a wyvern.

name: Icetrap Leaf
desc: The thin, twitching leaf of an icetrap.

name: Coneflower
desc: Brought back from the New World in the west, this plant bearing large, horn-shaped flowers has been recently discovered to be effective in curing several different ailments.

name: Cow Bitter
desc: This sweet-smelling perennial can be found growing in all of the Three Great Continents.

name: Dandelion
desc: This common flower produces a globe of lightweight seeds that are carried remarkable distances when blown in the wind. While the stalk is filled with a toxic milky substance, the leaves and roots can be dried and brewed into medicinal infusions.

name: Gaelicatnip
desc: A relative to pepper- and spearmint, gaelicatnip is an aromatic herb often brewed into teas. While it has no effect on the five races, the oil contained in the leaves is known to cause gaelicats and other normally aggressive feline beastkin to exhibit excessively playful behavior.

name: Rue
desc: A low-growing shrub recognizable by its tiny yellow flowers and faint odor. The leaves contain a mild irritant that, when rubbed against the skin, may cause minor reddening and swelling.

name: Coriander
desc: A highly fragrant herb. The leaves can be harvested and used in salads, or the plant can be allowed to bolt and the seeds gathered and used to spice ale.

name: Aurum Regis Cylinder
desc: This small music box cylinder is studded with myriad pins arranged in a queer pattern. When placed in a music box and attached to the motor, the cylinder will rotate, causing the pins to strike the box's comb, creating music.

name: Thavnairian Leather
desc: This leather has been tanned and treated using techniques from the Near Eastern island of Thavnair.

name: Thavnairian Silk
desc: This silk has been spun from thread created by a worm found only on the Near Eastern island of Thavnair.

name: Atomos Corpulence
desc: A small piece of throbbing flesh sliced from the devourer of worlds, Atomos.

name: Steel Mainspring
desc: A coiled ribbon of steel commonly used in clockwork creations to perpetuate motion.

name: Steel Wheel Bearing
desc: Several steel balls set into a polished metal ring. It is used to reduce friction, allowing a wheel to spin with little resistance.

name: Lupin Seedling
desc: Its name meaning “wolf,” the lupin is a hardy plant resistant to the cold winds of the Eorzean north.

name: Iron Giant Scrap
desc: A jagged sheet of plating fallen from the armor of an iron giant.

name: Gobwalker Shielding
desc: Protective metal plating used in the fabrication of a magitek gobwalker G-VII.

name: Far Eastern Coin
desc: An oblong coin of gold commonly used in the Far East for bribes.

name: Toy Box Schema
desc: A detailed design document outlining the absurdly complex steps required to craft a toy box.

name: Fine Alumen
desc: A yellowish mineral used by leatherworkers to tan animal hides. This particular variety exhibits some of the best deodorizing properties of all alumen.

name: Shrub Seedling
desc: The seedling of a squat shrub favored by topiarists across the realm for its bright-green leaves and dense web of tiny branches.

name: Magnanimous Mogcrown
desc: A gaudy moogle-sized crown crafted by moogles for use during moogle celebrations.

name: Dusk Leather
desc: An especially dark variety of leather often used in formalwear and uniforms.

name: Cloud Coral
desc: A white lightweight coral found growing on the floating islands above Eorzea.

name: Coerthan Crab
desc: A freshwater crustacean only found in the coldest of lakes.

name: Fanged Clam
desc: When closed, the shells of this freshwater bivalve mollusk form a demonic rictus that will haunt your nightmares until the end of time. Possibly beyond.

name: Lake Urchin
desc: A freshwater urchin which survives by eating the sparse algal blooms in Twinpools.

name: Blueclaw Shrimp
desc: A freshwater shrimp native to the Whilom River.

name: Rock Mussel
desc: A tiny freshwater bivalve mollusk native to the lukewarm waters of the Whilom River in the Dravanian forelands.

name: Blue Cloud Coral
desc: A blue lightweight coral found growing on the floating islands above Eorzea.

name: Seema Patrician
desc: A fatty freshwater fish native to Twinpools.

name: Pipira Pira
desc:
A deadly freshwater fish which will tear away flesh with its razor-sharp teeth. Crossing the Whilom River barefoot is not recommended.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]

name: Mogpom
desc: An algal sphere found collecting in the lone pool on the floating islet of Greensward.

name: Sweetfish
desc: A delicious (though unsweet) freshwater fish native to the Thaliak River.

name: Gloaming Coral
desc: A variety of cloud coral seen growing on the undersides of the floating islets that make up the Landlord Colony.

name: Unidentified Flying Biomass
desc: Beyond the fact one can find it in the skies near the Habisphere, absolutely nothing is known about this lump of flying...something.

name: Spring Urchin
desc: A freshwater creature that prefers the warm waters released by the springs at Dragonspit.

name: Ishgardian Tea
desc:
Rather than adding milk to boiling water that has been infused with tea leaves, as is the fashion in lower Eorzea, Ishgardian tea is brewed by boiling yak milk and letting dried Coerthan tea leaves steep right into the hot liquid.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Fig Bavarois
desc:
A ripe Old World fig encased in a lightly sweetened jelly.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Sohm Al Tart
desc:
A traditional Ishgardian cake made up of several stacked layers tapered to resemble Sohm Al, a peak sacred to the Dravanians. Ishgardians believe that devouring the mountain will grant them fortune in their struggle with the dragons.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Kaiser Roll
desc:
A round Ishgardian bread first made by Halonic monastics who, when brewing ale, would add barm and leftover malt to their daily loaves.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Ishgardian Muffin
desc:
Leavened bread that is cooked on a griddle rather than in an oven. Cornmeal is dusted on the dough before cooking to prevent sticking to the pan.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Sauteed Porcini
desc:
Fragrant porcini mushrooms sliced and sautéed in butter. Simple, yet elegant.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Royal Eggs
desc:
A breakfast dish consisting of an Ishgardian muffin sliced into halves and topped with salmon, a poached egg, and a creamy yellow sauce made from butter and egg yolks.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Deep-fried Okeanis
desc:
Thinly sliced okeanis fried in oil.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Beet Soup
desc:
Sliced magma beets and lean loaghtan meat slow-cooked with vegetables and served with a dollop of rich sour cream. A dish popular throughout Ishgard, though families in the Brume often use the meat of animals easier to find in the district's dark back alleys.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Gastornis Egg
desc: The hard-shelled egg of a gastornis.

name: Okeanis Egg
desc: The soft-shelled, slime-covered, ever-so-slightly warm egg of an okeanis.

name: Loaghtan Chump
desc: A marbled piece of meat taken from the rump of a loaghtan where the leg meets the loin.

name: Dhalmel Meat
desc: A gristle-filled slice of meat that will require extensive simmering for it to be rendered palatable.

name: Okeanis Tail
desc: When skinned, this slice of serpent-like meat almost appears edible.

name: Cockatrice Thigh
desc: A lean slice of cockatrice meat good for flavorful broths.

name: Pearl Sprouts
desc: Tiny cabbage-like vegetables native to the highlands of Coerthas.

name: Cyclops Onion
desc: A giant yellow onion often found growing on Abalathia's Spine.

name: Emerald Beans
desc: A deep-green legume recently discovered growing on the floating islets above the Sea of Clouds.

name: Highland Wheat
desc: A variety of dark-colored wheat suited to the rocky soil, shorter days, and colder temperatures of the Coerthas highlands.

name: Highland Flour
desc: Finely milled highland wheat. It has a rich, earthy aroma.

name: Coerthan Tea Leaves
desc: Considerably smaller than Thanalan tea leaves, more than double the amount of Ishgardian tea leaves are required to brew a single cup of tea.

name: Mist Dill
desc: A fragrant herb characterized by its thin leaves. It is used in both medicines and culinary dishes.

name: Chives
desc: A thin green onion used in many Ishgardian dishes.

name: Magma Beet
desc: A sweet, easy-to-grow tuber native to Abalathia's Spine, these deep-red beets are a staple in Ishgardian culinary culture.

name: Heavenly Kukuru Powder
desc: A sweet, fragrant powder ground from high-quality kukuru beans imported from exotic lands at a great price. A delicacy only available to the Holy See's most privileged.

name: Sesame Seeds
desc: A tiny seed rich in aromatic oil, sesame is native to Meracydia, and thought to have first been brought to Eorzea by migrating Miqo'te.

name: Yak Milk
desc:
The unique flavor of yak milk can be somewhat off-putting to those raised on cow or aldgoat milk.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Heavens Lemon
desc:
Possibly due to the increased sunlight it receives growing above the clouds, heavens lemons lack the acidity of normal sun lemons.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Hollandaise Sauce
desc: A rich sauce created with butter, egg yolks, and a hint of lemon.

name: Birch Sap
desc: A thin clear sap harvested from birch trees.

name: Birch Syrup
desc: Birch sap boiled down to a thick, sweet syrup.

name: Dark Chestnut
desc: The spine-encased fruit of the dark chestnut tree.

name: Sour Cream
desc: A thick cream created by fermenting yak milk.

name: Fermented Butter
desc: Slightly pungent butter allowed to ferment for several days after churning.

name: Old World Fig
desc:
A symbol of long life and femininity, this autumn fruit was originally brought from their homeland to Eorzea by the Sharlayans.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Cloud Banana
desc:
Though it resembles a tree, cloud bananas actually grow from an oversized herb. That does not, however, make them any less sweet.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Morel
desc: This rare mushroom with an oblong webbed cap is highly sought after by culinarians the realm over.

name: Porcini
desc: A large fragrant mushroom popular in Coerthan cuisine.

name: Chysahl Greens
desc: Though nearly identical in shape and color to gysahl greens, chysahl greens have a deeper, earthier flavor that chocobos (and man) seem to prefer.

name: Abalathian Rock Salt
desc: Mined from veins found in Abalathia's Spine, this pinkish salt has a high mineral content which adds depth to its flavor.

name: Honeydew Almonds
desc: A sweet variety of rare white almonds.

name: Dravanian Paprika
desc: A rare pepper that is more sweet than it is spicy.

name: Snurbleberry
desc:
This sweet, yet tart red berry is covered in tiny soft hairs that can be removed by lightly rubbing the fruit between one's palms.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Bouillon Cube
desc: Animal broth that has been reduced down to a paste and hardened into cubes which will keep for an extended duration.

name: Oriental Soy Sauce
desc: Similar to Mun-Tuy sauce, this Far Eastern seasoning is made by fermenting soybeans in salt and then pressing the beans to collect the remaining savory liquid.

name: Oriental Miso Paste
desc: Similar to Mun-Tuy paste, this Far Eastern seasoning is made by fermenting soybeans in salt.

name: Vermicelli
desc: Thin noodles made with highland flour, eggs, water, and salt. These have been dried and will keep indefinitely.

name: Mossy Stone Greatsword
desc: A greatsword crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

name: Mossy Stone Cannon
desc: A hand cannon crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

name: Mossy Stone Globe
desc: A star globe crafted from giantsgall, a type of stone found on Thavnair. It is so covered in moss as to be rendered unusable.

name: Celestine
desc: A light-blue crystalline mineral which, when ground and added to any flammable material, will cause it to burn red.

name: Garlond Steel
desc: A lightweight form of steel developed by the eponymous chief engineer of the Garlond Ironworks.

name: Purified Coke
desc: A hot-burning fuel created by destructively distilling raw coal. This particular piece contains very few impurities, allowing for longer, hotter combustion.

name: Raziqcoat
desc: Developed by a Near Eastern alchemist, this powder is used to treat and harden aurum regis.

name: Dryad Sap
desc: A partially congealed ball of sticky sap extracted from a dryad.

name: Moonbeam Silk
desc: A brilliant white silk spun by a rare breed of Eorzean spider.

name: Odorless Animal Fat
desc: This gobbet of beastkin tissue does not exhibit the rancid odor most commonly associated with animal fat.

name: Duskborne Aethersand
desc: The elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced matter. This fine sand emits a weak glow indiscernible during the day.

name: Dawnborne Aethersand
desc: The elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced matter. This fine sand emits a brilliant light discernible even at midday.

name: Landborne Aethersand
desc: The elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced mineral matter.

name: Leafborne Aethersand
desc: The elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced floral matter.

name: Seaborne Aethersand
desc: The elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced sea life.

name: Dravanian Mistletoe
desc: A variety of parasitic plant found growing on trees in the Churning Mists.

name: Abalathian Mistletoe
desc: A variety of parasitic plant found growing on trees in the Sea of Clouds.

name: Red Alumen
desc: A reddish variety of the mineral used by leatherworkers to tan animal hides. It lacks the deodorizing properties of its lighter counterpart.

name: Black Soil
desc: This rich, dark soil receives its color from a high concentration of organic matter.

name: Highland Oregano
desc: Due to its higher oil content, highland oregano is preferred over other breeds of oregano by apothecaries and perfumeries across Eorzea.

name: Furymint
desc: Named after the spear-like shape of its leaves, this variety of mint has a cooler, less biting flavor than its darker-leaved cousin peppermint.

name: Clary Sage
desc: A fragrant herb used in medicines, perfumes, and cooking.

name: Haddock
desc: A whitefish perfect for frying.

name: Iron Giant Core
desc: The control unit of an iron giant.

name: Coffin Lid
desc: Pried from the lid of a coffin, this plank of ancient wood is cold to the touch.

name: Sephirot Sap
desc: Left behind by the Fiend, this lump of sap appears to pulse with aetheric energy.

name: Fiend Sap
desc: Left behind by the Fiend, this lump of sap appears to induce growth in living organisms.

name: Stack of Tomes
desc: A neatly assembled collection of works ranging from poetry to history. A tidy bibliophile's dream.

name: Pile of Tomes
desc: A slightly strewn collection of works ranging from mythology to philosophy. A tidy bibliophile's nightmare.

name: Pterodactyl Strap
desc: A thin leather strap cut from the cured hide of a pterodactyl.

name: Titanium Alloy Square
desc: A thin, tiny plate of hammered titanium alloy.

name: Blessed Fletchings
desc: Arrow fletchings crafted from the large, rigid feathers of an eagle and then blessed by an anointed Halonic priest.

name: Moogle Miniature
desc: A small ceramic figurine bearing the likeness of a plump moogle.

name: Pterodactyl
desc: A winged scalekin native to the Diadem.

name: Gem Marimo
desc: A bright-green variety of aquatic moss found on the bottom of lakes. Slight currents cause the moss to gather and form into a ball as it grows.

name: Retribution Staff
desc: A large freshwater fish native to the Diadem.

name: Wind Silk
desc: This silk is exposed to aetherial turbulence in order to strengthen its aspect to wind.

name: Dinosaur Leather
desc: A large piece of cured dinosaur skin.

name: Falconer's Hemp
desc: A double-weave variety of hemp used by falconers to protect themselves from the sharp talons of their raptors.

name: Titanium Alloy Ingot
desc: A durable alloy created by smelting titanium with zinc.

name: Cloud Cloth
desc: Soft, light cotton woven from rare cloud cotton bolls.

name: Pterodactyl Leather
desc: A large piece of cured pterodactyl skin.

name: Sphalerite
desc: A semi-translucent mineral containing large amounts of zinc and iron.

name: Potters Stone
desc: A hard clay found exclusively on the islets of the Diadem. When fired in a kiln, the result is a brilliant white pottery.

name: Royal Mistletoe
desc: A parasitic plant that is only found growing on the trees of the Diadem.

name: Cloud Cotton Boll
desc: The cloud-like flower of a cotton plant native to the Diadem.

name: Blood Pepper
desc: A deep red variety of dragon pepper so hot it is widely believed by Far Eastern cultures to drive away malignant spirits.

name: Dravanian Mote
desc: This lighter-than-air flora is unique to the Churning Mists.

name: Oriental Grass Tuft
desc: A tall variety of grass common in the Far East.

name: Cassia Block
desc: An expertly cut cube of fragrant cassia lumber.

name: Red Oldroses
desc:
A bunch of red oldroses, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Blue Oldroses
desc:
A bunch of blue oldroses, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Yellow Oldroses
desc:
A bunch of yellow oldroses, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

desc:
A bunch of green oldroses, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

name: Orange Oldroses

name: Purple Oldroses
desc:
A bunch of purple oldroses, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

A bunch of white oldroses, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

name: Black Oldroses
desc:
A bunch of black oldroses, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

name: Rainbow Oldroses
desc:
A bunch of multicolored oldroses, selectively fertilized to achieve a variety of vibrant colors.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Golden Apple
desc:
A mildly sweet apple with a tart aftertaste, this rare fruit is highly sought after amongst bakers.

(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Solstice Garlic
desc: Favored by chefs for leaving one's breath scant of odor after a meal, this zesty garlic is often used in gourmet dishes.

name: Mature Olive Oil
desc: A rich-tasting oil produced with pressed olives at the peak of ripeness.

name: Loaghtan Fillet
desc: Taken from the upper loin of a domesticated loaghtan, this meat is tender enough that it does not require any preparation before cooking.

name: High Mythrite Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted lumythrite.

name: Eikon Mythrite
desc: Mythrite blessed by a primal.

name: Lumythrite Ore
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be lumythrite.

name: Eikon Iron Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted iron blessed by a primal.

name: Eikon Metal
desc: A heavy piece of unidentifiable metal blessed by a primal.

name: Smithsonite Ore
desc: This slightly lustrous ore is characterized by its extremely high zinc content.

name: Eikon Cloth
desc: Finely woven cloth blessed by a primal.

name: Eikon Fiber
desc: Tightly spun thread blessed by a primal.

name: Frost Cotton Boll
desc: A soft and fluffy variety of cotton named for its resemblance to morning hoarfrost.

name: Eikon Leather
desc: A large piece of cured beastkin skin blessed by a primal.

name: Eikon Hide
desc: The skin of a large, yet unidentifiable creature, blessed by a primal.

name: Treated Camphorwood Lumber
desc: A processed length of camphor lumber, treated with an alchemical agent to harden the wood.

name: Camphorwood Lumber
desc: Processed camphor lumber. Its piquant aroma remains years after harvesting, making it a favorite for use in armoires and furnishings.

name: Camphorwood Log
desc: A rough-cut log of camphorwood timber.

name: Camphorwood Branch
desc: The thick branch of a camphorwood tree.

name: Camphor
desc: The waxy, crystallized remnants of a liquid drawn from steamed bits of camphorwood.

name: Gobcraft Resin
desc: A synthetic resin created by the goblins to protect leatherwork and carpentry from the elements.

name: Grade 3 Strength Dissolvent
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to strength, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to dexterity, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to vitality, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to intelligence, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Rainbow Daisies
desc:
A bunch of multicolored daisies, selectively fertilized to achieve a variety of vibrant colors.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Blade of Revelry
desc: The blade from a sword used by the Lord of the Revel himself. Despite being long removed from its hilt, the steel still shudders with unseen magicks.

name: Blissful Shroud
desc: A long sheet of translucent cloth taken from the robes worn by the Lady of the Bliss. In addition with being unnaturally lightweight, the shroud tingles the skin when touched.

name: Steppe Tea
desc:
A thick, creamy beverage popular on the Azim Steppe made from steeped fermented tea leaves and a generous helping of dzo milk.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Tea Brick
desc: The fermenting of tea leaves is common practice in the Far East where tea is consumed multiple times a day. Fermentation is thought to enhance flavor while dulling the leaves' natural bitterness. Fermented leaves are pressed into bricks to save space when shipping.

name: Gyr Abanian Flour
desc: Finely milled Gyr Abanian wheat.

name: Firm Tofu
desc: A traditional source of protein in the Far East, tofu is made from curdled soy bean extract.

name: Rice Vinegar
desc: One of Far Eastern cuisine's five main seasonings, rice vinegar is slightly more sweet and mild than Aldenard's vinegars of popoto or apple.

name: Beet Sugar
desc: A sweetener made by juicing sugar beets and then boiling the extract down until all the water has evaporated, leaving only a fine, grey powder.

name: Cooking Sake
desc: Far Eastern rice wine prepared with other ingredients for use in cooking. Often added to seafood dishes to remove unpleasant aromas.

name: Cottonseed Oil
desc: Cooking oil pressed from ruby cotton seeds. Its high flash point and lack of odor make it ideal for deep-frying.

name: Nigari
desc: A coagulant naturally found in seawater, commonly used in the Far East to make tofu.

name: Algae Salt
desc: A briny salt harvested by sun-drying then burning sea algae.

name: Koshu Sticky Rice
desc: Unlike the drier varieties common in Aldenard and Ilsabard, this particular strand of Far Eastern rice becomes extremely sticky when cooked.

name: Buckwheat Kernels
desc: A nutty grain that can be substituted for flour in breads and noodles. Found across the Three Great Continents, but grown in abundance in the heart of Gyr Abania.

name: Loquat
desc:
A sweet yet slightly tangy fruit with a thin skin and a fleshy orange interior. Can be found in the warmer valleys of Gyr Abania.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Othardian Plum
desc:
A greenish-pink plum common across the eastern continent of Othard.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Kudzu Root
desc: The root of the quick-growing kudzu vine is dug up and processed into kudzu powder which serves as a substitute for animal-based gelatins in Far Eastern desserts. It also is believed to exhibit healing properties, and can be found in most Hingan and Doman apothecaries.

name: Doman Eggplant
desc: While just as brilliantly purple, this Far Eastern cousin of the wizard eggplant is noticeably thinner, and thus requires less time to cook.

name: Daikon Radish
desc: The spicy daikon radishes of Othard are known to grow as long and thick as a grown Hyur's forearm.

name: Sugar Beet
desc: These tubers can be several times sweeter than most fruit, and as such are commonly processed into sugar for sweetening cakes and other confections.

name: Jhammel Ginger
desc: Jhammel ginger's bulbous, aromatic roots can be sliced fresh and added to stews and seafood dishes to remove gaminess, ground and steeped in hot water to cure head colds, or dried and ground into a powder to use as a spice for breads and cookies.

name: Gyr Abanian Carrot
desc: Gyr Abanian carrots are not only longer, but a far deeper orange─nay, crimson─than those grown in central and western Eorzea.

name: Green Leek
desc: Similar to green onions in flavor, the leeks of Gyr Abania are several times thicker, and far more piquant.

name: Bamboo Shoot
desc: If removed from the ground when less than a fulm in length, bamboo shoots can be peeled and the fleshy interior eaten. A popular ingredient in Far Eastern stews and stir-fries.

name: Mountain Popoto
desc: Crisp mountain popotoes contain high quantities of starch that create a viscous paste when the tubers are ground. This paste can be eaten raw, fried into cakes, or added to stews for thickening.

name: Soybeans
desc: These emerald legumes grow two to three beans per pod on stout bushes that are ready for harvest in the early fall. The beans are most often pressed into the milk which is used to make tofu, or fermented into various savory pastes and sauces.

name: Shiitake Mushroom
desc: These fungi native to the Far East are rarely eaten raw, the majority of those harvested dried, then used to make soup stock.

name: Cumin Seeds
desc: A pungent spice that can be used in seed form, or ground into a powder, enhancing the aroma tenfold.

name: Lotus Root
desc: Though they appear solid from the outside, the cylindrical root nodules of the lotus flower are riddled with holes, possibly to accommodate for the waterlogged environments in which the plant grows.

name: Sun Cabbage
desc: The sweet, tightly packed leaves of Othardian sun cabbages are deceptively sweet, making them perfect in salads or stews.

name: Fennel
desc: With an aroma similar to licorice, both the stalks and the seeds of this Othardian herb can be used to enhance the flavor of exotic Far Eastern dishes.

name: Gyr Abanian Wheat
desc: A close cousin to highland wheat, Gyr Abanian wheat has been improved by Ala Mhigan farmers over generations to increase both flavor and yield.

name: Persimmon
desc:
A hard, orange fruit common in eastern Othard. It is well known that seven summers must pass before a newly planted persimmon tree will bear fruit.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Persimmon Leaf
desc: While not edible, the leaves of the persimmon tree are oft used in the preservation of other food.

name: Gyr Abanian Mineral Water
desc: Clear water taken from a mountain spring on the eastern end of Abalathia's Spine.

name: Crescent Spring Water
desc: Clear, odorless water taken from one of the many springs found on Othard's Fanged Crescent.

name: Dzo Chuck
desc: The unbearably tough shoulder meat of a steppe dzo.

name: Hornbill Tenderloin
desc: A lean piece of meat taken from under the short ribs of an Othardian hornbill.

name: Jhammel Haunch
desc: Heavy salting and spicing are methods commonly employed to remove the oft overpowering gaminess of this beastkin flesh.

name: Koshu Pork
desc: A dark-haired variety of swine bred on Hingashi's Koshu island. Its carefully selected diet is believed to render its meat tender and its fat flavorful.

name: Gagana Egg
desc: The massive egg of a gagana.

name: Steppe Milk
desc:
Compared to that of an aldgoat, marid, or deathmouse, the milk of a steppe dzo is high in fat and flavor.

F201F8F201F9EXP Bonus:0101 +3%  F201F8F201F9Duration:0101 30m
(Duration can be extended to 60m by consuming multiple servings)

name: Ama Nori
desc: This edible seaweed can be consumed raw, or dried into paper-like squares and wrapped around sticky rice.

name: Ruby Tide Kelp
desc: A distant cousin of malm kelp, Ruby Tide kelp is harvested and dried in the sun to enhance flavor. Squares of the seaweed are cut and steeped in boiling water to create one of the savory broths used in Hingan cuisine.

name: Gem Algae
desc: A variety of algae found in the Ruby Sea, commonly harvested for its salt.

name: Grade 1 Reisui of Strength
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to strength, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 1 Reisui of Dexterity
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to dexterity, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 1 Reisui of Vitality
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to vitality, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 1 Reisui of Intelligence
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to intelligence, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 1 Reisui of Mind
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to mind, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 2 Reisui of Strength
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to strength, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 2 Reisui of Dexterity
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to dexterity, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 2 Reisui of Vitality
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to vitality, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 2 Reisui of Intelligence
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to intelligence, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 2 Reisui of Mind
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to mind, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Enchanted Koppranickel Ink
desc: Ink fortified with koppranickel sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

name: Enchanted Durium Ink
desc: Ink fortified with durium sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

name: Enchanted Palladium Ink
desc: Ink fortified with palladium sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

name: Growth Formula Eta
desc: This alchemically formulated potation accelerates the growth of foliage.

name: Growth Formula Theta
desc: This alchemically formulated potation accelerates the growth of foliage.

name: Beetle Glue
desc: An adhesive substance created by grinding down the chitinous carapaces of beetles and mixing it with heated pine resin.

name: Ala Mhigan Salt Crystal
desc: These pinkish crystals grow naturally on the shores of Loch Seld.

name: Pine Resin
desc: A sticky substance secreted by pine trees when their limbs are cut.

name: Persimmon Tannin
desc: A translucent liquid extracted from persimmon wood by steeping it in hot water. Used in the tanning of raw animal hides.

name: Gyr Abanian Alumen
desc: A brownish variety of the mineral used by leatherworkers to tan animal hides. It is only found in the mountains of Eastern Aldenard.

name: Yanxian Parsley
desc: This Far Eastern perennial has a biting aroma that even many Othardians find off-putting.

name: Alyssum
desc: This annual is coveted by perfumers for its honey-sweet aroma.

name: Nagxian Cudweed
desc: Though recognized as a weed, this winter annual is edible and will oft be harvested in the late months for use in various Doman and Hingan dishes.

name: Chickweed
desc: Though recognized as a weed, this winter annual is edible and will oft be harvested in the late months for use in various Doman and Hingan dishes.

name: Nipplewort
desc: Named for the protruding buds from which its bright-yellow flowers bloom, nipplewort is a common winter annual whose leaves are gathered for use in Othardian cuisine.

name: Windtea Leaves
desc: When steeped in boiling water, the leaves of this rare perennial change color, turning a bright bluish green.

name: Holy Basil
desc: An herb with an aroma so heavenly, it will cleanse both your soul and your palate of ill flavors (or so say merchants who would see you buy their stock).

name: Hallowed Basil
desc: An herb with an aroma so heavenly, the gods themselves must have blessed it (or so say merchants who would see you buy their stock).

name: Muud Suud Horn
desc: The curved horn of a muud suud.

name: Gazelle Horn
desc: The twisted horn of a gazelle.

name: Dzo Horn
desc: The massive ebon horn of a steppe dzo.

name: Moth Scales
desc: The powdery scales of a giant moth's wing.

name: Bombfish Spine
desc: A single adult bombfish can have as many as a thousand of these lightweight-yet-sturdy spines jutting from its body.

name: Rhino Beetle Carapace
desc: The thick chitinous head of a rhino beetle, complete with eyes, antennae, and mandibles.

name: Beech Lumber
desc: Processed beech lumber.

name: Larch Lumber
desc: Processed larch lumber.

name: Persimmon Lumber
desc: Processed persimmon lumber.

name: Zelkova Lumber
desc: Processed zelkova lumber.

name: Torreya Lumber
desc: Processed torreya lumber.

name: Beech Log
desc: A rough-cut log of beech timber.

name: Larch Log
desc: A rough-cut log of larch timber.

name: Persimmon Log
desc: A rough-cut log of persimmon timber.

name: Zelkova Log
desc: A rough-cut log of zelkova timber.

name: Torreya Log
desc: A rough-cut log of torreya timber.

name: Scarlet Urushi
desc: This glossy red coating, made from the sap of the lacquer tree, is used to both color and preserve wooden crafts.

name: Koppranickel Nugget
desc: A small nugget of impure koppranickel.

name: High Steel Nugget
desc: A small nugget of impure high steel.

name: Koppranickel Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted koppranickel.

name: High Steel Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted high steel.

name: Durium Nugget
desc: A small nugget of impure durium.

name: Oroshigane Ingot
desc: An ingot of Doman iron, smelted using Far Eastern techniques.

name: Durium Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted durium.

name: Tama-hagane Ingot
desc: An ingot of Doman steel, smelted using Far Eastern techniques.

name: Palladium Nugget
desc: A small nugget of impure palladium.

name: Molybdenum Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted molybdenum.

name: Palladium Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted palladium.

name: Chromite Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted chromite.

name: Koppranickel Sand
desc: Amber-colored sand consisting of tiny grains of koppranickel.

name: Koppranickel Ore
desc: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal koppranickel.

name: Durium Sand
desc: Jade-colored sand consisting of tiny grains of durium.

name: Doman Iron Ore
desc: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal Doman iron (also known as mochi iron for its resemblance to the Far Eastern rice cakes).

name: Durium Ore
desc: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal durium.

name: Doman Iron Sand
desc: Metallic sand consisting of tiny grains of Doman iron.

name: Palladium Sand
desc: Silver-colored sand consisting of tiny grains of palladium.

name: Molybdenum Ore
desc: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal molybdenum.

name: Palladium Ore
desc: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal palladium.

name: Chromite Ore
desc: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal chromium.

name: Domacoat
desc: Not to be outdone by their Near Eastern counterparts who perfected the aurum regis-hardening agent, Raziqcoat, several Far Eastern alchemists have joined together to create Domacoat─a substance capable of hardening palladium.

name: Bone Charcoal
desc: Not actually created from bones, this hot-burning fuel is the result of baking coal in an airless furnace at an extremely high temperature.

name: Triphane
desc: A yellow jewel.

name: Kyanite
desc: A light-blue jewel.

name: Star Spinel
desc: A violet jewel.

name: Azurite
desc: A deep blue jewel.

name: Imperial Jade
desc: Also known as “true jade,” this milky green stone is coveted by the Far Eastern elite.

name: Rhodonite
desc: A blood red jewel.

name: Raw Triphane
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be triphane.

name: Raw Kyanite
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be kyanite.

name: Raw Star Spinel
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be star spinel.

name: Raw Azurite
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be azurite.

name: Raw Imperial Jade
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be imperial jade.

name: Raw Rhodonite
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be rhodonite.

name: Bloodhempen Cloth
desc: Several yalms of undyed, bright-red bloodhempen cloth wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

name: Bloodhempen Yarn
desc: Coarse yarn spun from bloodhemp fiber.

name: Bloodhemp
desc: A common grass found growing throughout Othard. From its stalks, bloodhempen yarn is created.

name: Ruby Cotton Cloth
desc: Several yalms of undyed ruby cotton cloth wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

name: Ruby Cotton Yarn
desc: Light yarn spun from ruby cotton.

name: Ruby Cotton Boll
desc: The fibrous flower of a rare cotton plant that only grows under the Ruby Sea. As such, Eorzean scholars insist that the flora is in no way related to normal cotton, and is instead a unique variety of sea kelp.

name: Kudzu Cloth
desc: Several yalms of undyed kudzu cloth wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

name: Kudzu Thread
desc: Thick, fibrous yarn spun from kudzu vines.

name: Kudzu Vine
desc: If allowed to grow unchecked, a single kudzu plant can cover an acre of forest in less than a single summer, blocking the sun from the plants it envelops. A large swath of the outer Black Shroud currently finds itself being slowly suffocated by the invasive weed.

name: Steppe Serge
desc: Several yalms of undyed steppe serge wrapped around a short wooden distaff.

name: Worsted Yarn
desc: Soft, water-absorbent yarn spun from multiple varieties of hair sheared from beastkin of the Azim Steppe.

name: Halgai Mane
desc: The regal mane of a halgai.

name: Manzasiri Hair
desc: The long brown hair of a steppe manzasiri.

name: Twinsilk
desc: Though exhibiting a similar luster as normal silk, twinsilk is far more durable and resistant to discoloring.

name: Twinthread
desc: A thin lustrous thread woven from countless silken strands pulled from a rare highland twincoon.

name: Twincoon
desc: A massive cocoon spun by not one, but multiple highland erucas.

name: Rhea Cloth
desc: Cloth woven from the plant rhea. Due to the complexity of the spinning process, there are very few clothcrafters in the world who can produce this weave, making it extremely rare. Most known samples are in the possession of Far Eastern royalty.

name: Rhea
desc: A variety of ramie better suited to the climes of Far Eastern Othard.

name: Doman Weave
desc: Hempen cloth woven using age-old methods passed down for countless generations by Doman clothiers.

name: Gagana Leather
desc: A large piece of cured gagana skin.

name: Gyuki Leather
desc: A large piece of cured gyuki hide.

name: Tiger Leather
desc: A large piece of cured tiger skin.

name: Marid Leather
desc: A large piece of cured marid hide.

name: Gazelle Leather
desc: A large piece of cured gazelle hide.

name: True Griffin Leather
desc: A large piece of cured true griffin hide.

name: Gagana Skin
desc: The rough skin of a majestic gagana.

name: Gyuki Hide
desc: The smooth hide of a devilish gyuki.

name: Tiger Skin
desc: The striped skin of a ferocious tiger.

name: Marid Hide
desc: The thick hide of a mammoth marid.

name: Gazelle Hide
desc: The bristly hide of a steppe gazelle.

name: True Griffin Hide
desc: The downy hide of a true griffin.

name: Forbidden Wax
desc: Forbidden in many markets for the nefarious means with which it is extracted, this wax is cherished by leatherworkers for the luster it brings to tanned hides when applied.

name: Diatomite
desc: Geological scholars claim that this sedimentary stone is actually comprised of the shells of thousands upon thousands of tiny sea creatures.

name: Slate
desc: Unlike other sedimentary stone, slate has been compressed under the weight of mountains for so long that it is surprisingly hard, making it ideal for whetstones and grinding stones.

name: Slate Whetstone
desc: A whetstone carved from slate. Used for sharpening metal or stone blades.

name: Perlite
desc: A strange, pearlescent volcanic rock that expands tenfold upon heating in a kiln or forge.

name: Almandine
desc: A garnet-like mineral that, due to its extreme hardness, is used in grinding wheels.

name: Dusklight Aethersand
desc: The elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced matter. This fine sand emits a weak glow indiscernible at gloaming.

name: Dawnlight Aethersand
desc: The elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced matter. This fine sand emits a weak glow indiscernible at dawn.

name: Everbright Aethersand
desc: The elementally aspected remnants of highly concentrated aetherially reduced mineral matter.

name: Everborn Aethersand
desc: The elementally aspected remnants of highly concentrated aetherially reduced mineral matter.

name: Everdeep Aethersand
desc: The elementally aspected remnants of highly concentrated aetherially reduced mineral matter.

name: Zekki Grouper
desc:
Groupers gather in swift currents of the Ruby Sea and the Rasen Kaikyo to feed on the abundant life drawn to the area.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 2 and higher.]

name: Heather Charr
desc: A unique variety of freshwater charr found only in the waters near Heather Falls.

name: Lordly Salmon
desc: Just as do the salmon of Eorzea, the steely blue salmon of the Far East spend their lives in the sea before returning to the freshwater rivers where they were born to spawn and die.

name: Doman Eel
desc: A thin freshwater eel that can be found living amongst the reeds growing in the Valley of the Fallen Rainbow.

name: Corpse-eater
desc:
A large carnivorous wavekin that dwells in the warm currents of the southern seas.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]

name: Horned Turban
desc: The shell of this warm-water sea mollusk is twisted like the turbans worn by the dhalmel drivers of Thavnair.

name: Gauntlet Crab
desc: These giant crabs hide themselves amongst the plants that grow on a river's bed, the moss growing on their claws used as camouflage.

name: Swordtip
desc: One of the most widespread squid species on Hydaelyn.

name: Yanxian Tiger Prawn
desc: This Far Eastern crustacean has not only the stripes, but also the ferocity of a Yanxian tiger.

name: Steppe Bullfrog
desc: Steppe bullfrogs can be found across both Yanxia and Nagxia and are easily identifiable by their deep, bellowing mating croaks.

name: Amberjack
desc: This large saltwater predator can be found in the waters off both the eastern and western coasts of Hingashi.

name: River Clam
desc: A small bivalve mollusk found living in the sands of the One River.

name: Carpenter Crab
desc: A carpenter crab's claws are powerful enough to cut through solid wood. Whether or not a carpenter crab has ever constructed something from that wood remains unconfirmed.

name: Spiny Lobster
desc: This massive crustacean found in both the Ruby Sea and the Glass Ocean is considered a delicacy in the Far East, and is a luxury oft too extravagant for any but the richest of nobles to partake in.

name: River Bream
desc: Unlike sea breams, this quirky cousin will travel back and forth 'twixt the brackish waters of a river's delta and the fresher waters upstream.

name: Ivory Sole
desc: The whitish grey skin of this large flatfish allows it to hide itself on the bottom of Loch Seld with such efficiency that for years Ala Mhigans thought the species extinct.

name: Motley Beakfish
desc:
A striped carnivore that hunts the Ruby Sea.

[Suitable for display in aquariums tier 3 and higher.]

name: Nagxian Silk
desc: A light, billowy silk woven using traditional methods of the Nagxian people.

name: Ratanhia Leaves
desc: Leaves of a low-growing shrub native to the plains of Nagxia. The leaves contain high concentrations of tannin, an ingredient necessary in tanning leather.

name: Taoist's Wool
desc: Despite supposedly being woven countless generations past, this cloth appears as it was crafted yesterday.

name: Nagxian Leather
desc: A beastkin hide tanned using traditional Nagxian methods.

name: Hingan Chochin Lantern
desc: A round paper lantern with a handle attached for easy transportation.

name: Cloudsbreath
desc: Lack of imagination has led to most white flowers found growing in the skybound regions of Dravania and Abalathia to be named after clouds, this specimen featuring wing-like leaves being no exception.

name: Royal Fern
desc: The broad fronds of this brilliant green variety of fern are believed to be imbued with heavenly magicks.

name: Red Brightlilies
desc:
A bunch of red brightlilies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Blue Brightlilies
desc:
A bunch of blue brightlilies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Yellow Brightlilies
desc:
A bunch of yellow brightlilies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Green Brightlilies
desc:
A bunch of green brightlilies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Orange Brightlilies
desc:
A bunch of orange brightlilies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Purple Brightlilies
desc:
A bunch of purple brightlilies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: White Brightlilies
desc:
A bunch of white brightlilies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Black Brightlilies
desc:
A bunch of black brightlilies, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Rainbow Brightlilies
desc:
A bunch of multicolored brightlilies, selectively fertilized to achieve a variety of vibrant colors.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Gyr Abanian Alchemic
desc: An alchemical potation born in the Near East, and perfected in Gyr Abania.

name: Ala Mhigan Burdet
desc: A composite fabric made using Gyr Abanian materials and Garlean know-how.

name: Snailfish Oil
desc: Thick, pungent oil cold-pressed from the writhing corpse of a deep-water snailfish.

name: Gyr Abanian Spring Water
desc: Cold, clear mountain water harvested from hidden springs located in the highlands of Gyr Abania.

name: Azim Cotton Boll
desc: The white of Azim cotton is so bright that some compare it to staring at the sun itself.

name: Secret Recipe Broth
desc: A clear, briny broth made by boiling down fish. There really is no secret.

name: Shinryu's Scale
desc: Large, chitinous scale that once protected the legendary dragon, Shinryu (albeit not very well).

name: Gyr Abanian Souvenir Component
desc: A component used to complete a Gyr Abanian souvenir.

name: Far Eastern Antique Component
desc: A component used to complete a Far Eastern antique.

name: Gold Saucer Consolation Prize Component
desc: A component used to complete a Gold Saucer consolation prize and ensure that everyone goes home a winner.

name: M Tribe Sundry Component
desc: A component used to complete one of many sundries used by the M tribe in daily life.

name: Resistance Materiel Component
desc: A component used to complete a piece of Ala Mhigan Resistance materiel.

name: Gyr Abanian Souvenir Component Materials
desc: Various materials necessary to craft Gyr Abanian souvenir components.
