name: Aurelia Polyp
desc:
Lighter than air─er...water.

Use item to acquire the aurelia polyp minion.

name: Byakko's Mane
desc: The brilliant white mane of the Far Eastern white tiger of legend. He probably won't miss it.

name: Alpha's Feather
desc: A single yellow feather fallen from the chocobo Alpha.

name: Usuginu Octopus
desc: This crafty cephalopod can be found all along the Ruby Sea coastline─usually in the belly of some Hingan fisher who has eaten the creature raw and with a splash of soy sauce and citrus.

name: Thavnairian Resin
desc: A long-lasting synthetic resin concocted by Radz-at-Han's finest alchemists. Used as both an adhesive as well as a varnish.

name: Thavnairian Abrasive
desc: A coarse-grained abrasive concocted by Radz-at-Han's finest alchemists. Used to restore the luster of even the most corroded metals.

name: Thavnairian Cotton
desc: A traditional Near Eastern weave that keeps its wearer cool while protecting her from the harsh rays of the sun.

name: Thavnairian Alumen
desc: Quarried from Thavnair's towering sea cliffs, this mineral is prized by leatherworkers for its use in tanning hides.

name: Thavnairian Adhesive
desc: Countless Hannish alchemists have chosen death over revealing the secret recipe of this odorless paste used in the creation of some of the island nation's most valuable armor.

name: Nightsteel Ore
desc: Iron ore that has been exposed to the waters of a mineral spring, and undergone significant changes to both color and chemical makeup.

name: Silvergrace Ore
desc: A sizable piece of rock containing traces of a precious metal known as silvergrace.

name: Black Willow Log
desc: A rough-cut log of black willow timber.

name: Hingan Flax
desc: A distant cousin to the flax found in the highlands of Coerthas, the stalk of this fibrous plant is used to create a yarn known in Hingashi as “true linen.”

name: Ground Sloth Pelt
desc: The coarse, bristly hide of a giant ground sloth.

name: Grade 3 Reisui of Strength
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to strength, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 3 Reisui of Dexterity
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this Far Eastern potation will, similarly to Eorzean dissolvents, dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to dexterity, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Ground Sloth Leather

name: Dzo Sirloin
desc: A remarkably lean slice of red meat from the back of a steppe-grazing dzo.

name: Doman Rice
desc: A hardy hybrid of sweet, sticky rice perfected by Far Eastern farmers after countless generations of cross-pollination. Known in Yanxia as “Doman Sunrise.”

name: Crimson Coral
desc: A deep red piece of rare coral native to the Ruby Sea.

name: Colossus Slab
desc: This piece of carved stone appears to have once been part of a large statue.

name: Honeydew Honey
desc: Instead of from collecting pollen, this deep, flavorful variety of honey is made from bees collecting honeydew excreted by the aphids that gather on the flowers.

name: Holy Linen
desc: This length of true linen has been blessed by one or more religious figures of varying holiness.

name: Ala Mhigan Weave
desc: Cloth woven using traditional techniques that date back to the Fifth Astral Era.

name: Faded Copy of the Jade Stoa
desc: Timeworn pages of sheet music containing full scores for Answer on High and Amatsu Kaze.

name: True Linen
desc: Several yalms of undyed true linen wrapped around a short distaff.

name: Cracked Hanya Mask
desc: This gruesome visage will not be driving any evil spirits from the hearth in its current state.

name: Raw Sui-no-Sato Special Materials

name: Raw Cloud Pearl Materials

name: Elixir Mixing Paraphernalia Materials
desc:

name: Stormsap
desc: The chemical composition of this milky violet liquid is unknown, but its color─reminiscent of a thundercloud illuminated by lightning─has given rise to rumors surrounding its origins that have led to the unfortunate electrocution of many a scholar and profiteer alike.

name: Hawk's Eye
desc: A blue-grey jewel consisting of many colored layers. When polished, it resembles the piercing eye of a raptor.

name: Hardened Veteran Tree Sap
desc: A partially congealed ball of sticky sap extracted from an aged tree.

name: Kingcraft Demimateria
desc: A crystallized mass of residual spiritbond energies transferred to an article of weaponry or armor by its exceptionally skilled maker during the crafting process.

name: Duskglow Aethersand
desc: The elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced matter. This fine sand emits a crepuscular glow independent of ambient light.

name: Hawk's Eye Sand
desc: Conversion of the mineral hawk's eye via an alchemical process is the only way to create this incomparably fine sand.

name: Veteran Tree Sap
desc: This sap has been reverted from hardened lumps to its original liquid state via an alchemical process.

name: Celestial Kimono Remnant
desc: This length of fabric was cut from the Lady of the Moon's own kimono.

name: Wooden Hakutaku Eye
desc: A ligneous eyeball of the legendary Hakutaku. Rumor has it that its sight will be restored when immersed in blood.

name: Burning Hakutaku Eye
desc: A fiery eyeball of the legendary Hakutaku. Rumor has it that its sight will be restored when immersed in blood.

name: Earthen Hakutaku Eye
desc: A soiled eyeball of the legendary Hakutaku. Rumor has it that its sight will be restored when immersed in blood.

name: Golden Hakutaku Eye
desc: A lustrous eyeball of the legendary Hakutaku. Rumor has it that its sight will be restored when immersed in blood.

name: Damp Hakutaku Eye
desc: A dripping eyeball of the legendary Hakutaku. Rumor has it that its sight will be restored when immersed in blood.

name: Marine Wax Ester
desc: A saturated wax ester harvested from the fathomless abyss.

name: Empyrean Pine Log
desc: Though this was perhaps once a run-of-the-mill cutting of timber, it has since been warped in the oddest of ways by exposure to the powerful magicks of Heaven–on–High.

name: Empyrean Clay
desc: Though this was perhaps once unremarkable mud, it has since been warped in the oddest of ways by exposure to the powerful magicks of Heaven–on–High.

name: Faded Copy of Under the Moonlight
desc: Timeworn pages of sheet music containing full scores for Nightbloom and Wayward Daughter.

name: Faded Copy of Ambient Abyss
desc: Timeworn pages of sheet music containing a full panoply ambient melodies one might expect to hear under the sea.

name: Lizard Tail
desc: In defiance of all logic and natural laws, this tail is still partly alive, and twitches occasionally. Delightful.

name: Reishi Mushroom
desc: This rare mushroom is known for its high nutritive content...and not much else.

name: Pagos Spring Water
desc: Clear, cool water taken from a spring in the Pagos region of Eureka.

name: Pagos Sage
desc: A fragrant herb that can be used medicinally or to add a pleasant flavor to cuisine. The variety found in Pagos is notably crisp and hearty.

name: Oroniri Cloth
desc: The dyeing techniques used to color this bolt of cloth are unique to the Oronir.

name: Dotharli Cloth
desc: The dyeing techniques used to color this bolt of cloth are unique to the Dotharl.

name: Cloth Cointe Quaint
desc: No real lady of fashion would be caught dead wearing a skirt or─heavens forfend─a dress made from anything else.

name: Leather Cointe Quaint
desc: No real lady of fashion would be caught dead wearing a hat or─heavens forfend─shoes made from anything else.

name: Boutique Batiste
desc: No real gentleman of fashion would be caught dead wearing a shirt or─heavens forfend─pants made from anything else.

name: Boutique Boarded Leather
desc: No real gentleman of fashion would be caught dead wearing a hat or─heavens forfend─shoes made from anything else.

name: Scarlet Tailfeather
desc: A fiery red plume that previously adorned the auspice Suzaku.

name: Urunday Log
desc: A rough-cut log of urunday timber.

name: Yanxian Cotton Boll
desc: These whimsical cotton flowers, found only in Yanxia, glimmer faintly like stars in the night.

name: Procoptodon Skin
desc: The tough hide of a long-extinct marsupial. Unnervingly, it has somehow survived the test of time.

name: Gyr Abanian Carbon Rods
desc: Pure carbon used in the manufacture of specialty steel.

name: Tatara Iron Sand
desc: Fine metallic sand consisting of tiny grains of Doman iron, for use specifically in tatara smelting.

name: Stardust Cotton Yarn
desc: Glimmering yarn reminiscent of a comet's tail.

name: Gyr Abanian Wax
desc: A uniquely Gyr Abanian wax that renders even the most decrepit of hides supple and lustrous when applied as part of the tanning process.

name: High-gloss Urushi
desc: This black coating, made from the sap of the lacquer tree, is used to both color and preserve wooden crafts, and can be polished to an extraordinarily glossy sheen.

name: Chigusa Ingot
desc: An ingot of tatara-smelted Doman steel.

name: Evergleam Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted evergleam steel.

name: Urunday Lumber
desc: Processed urunday lumber.

name: Procoptodon Leather
desc: A large piece of cured procoptodon skin.

name: Stardust Cotton Cloth
desc: Several yalms of undyed stardust cotton wrapped around a short distaff.

name: Azim Spring Water
desc: Water of uncommon clarity sourced from underground springs on the Azim Steppe.

name: Reunion Cheese
desc: A washed-rind cheese made possible by the fortuitous meeting of a Steppe cheesemaker and an itinerant winemaker. It possesses a creamy texture and nutty flavor─though one would be forgiven for being skeptical, given the smell.

name: Juice Fermenting Supplies
desc: Pulped fruit, yeast, and other prepared supplies necessary for fermenting juice into alcohol.

name: Signature Buuz Cookware Materials
desc: Processed materials that can be combined into the necessary components for cooking authentic buuz.

name: Decorative Tavern Furnishing Materials
desc: Processed materials that genuinely look as if they could be used to create stylish furnishings.

name: Arkhi Brewing Vat Materials
desc: Processed materials that can be combined into the necessary components for brewing arkhi.

name: Raw Ishgardian Materials
desc: Unsorted and unrefined materials that look like any other sort of materials, but which you are assured are genuinely Ishgardian.

name: Raw Fermenting Supplies

name: Raw Steppe Cookware Materials
desc: Unsorted and unrefined materials from the Azim Steppe that you are assured can be used to create the necessary components for cooking authentic buuz.

name: Raw Tavern Furnishing Materials
desc: Unsorted and unrefined materials that look as if they could be used to create stylish furnishings─if you squint.

name: Raw Brewing Vat Materials

name: Seiryu's Scale
desc: A shimmering scale that once protected the body of the most venerable serpentine auspice.

name: Waterproof Cloth

name: Salvaged Coinage

name: Workshop Sign Materials

name: Lute Modification Component Materials

name: Sweets Ingredients
desc: Assorted ingredients for the preparation of desserts that will please the fae─such as sugar, sugar, and more sugar.

name: Zun Culinary Components
desc: Assorted ingredients for the traditional amaro feed used by the Zun.

A bunch of purple hydrangeas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: White Hydrangeas

A bunch of white hydrangeas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Black Hydrangeas

A bunch of black hydrangeas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Rainbow Hydrangeas
desc:
A bunch of multicolored hydrangeas, selectively fertilized to achieve a variety of vibrant colors.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Rose Shrimp
desc: This pink crustacean is both delicious and plentiful, resulting in its frequent use in a variety of Vrandtic dishes.

name: Spearhead Squid
desc: A reddish cephalopod with a pointed head.

name: Maneater Clam
desc: A bivalve mollusk with a shell that resembles nothing so much as rows of vicious teeth.

name: Sweetflesh Oyster
desc: The only defense that this particularly delicious variety of oyster has against being devoured is its thick shell.

name: Platinum Bream
desc: A shimmering, silvery fish.

name: Megapiranha
desc: A specimen belonging to a vicious species that seems to have survived largely unchanged since time immemorial.

name: White Oak Log
desc: A rough-cut log of white oak timber.

name: Miracle Apple Log
desc: A rough-cut log of miracle apple timber.

name: White Ash Log
desc: A rough-cut log of white ash timber.

name: Sandteak Log
desc: A rough-cut log of sandteak timber.

name: Lignum Vitae Log
desc: A rough-cut log of lignum vitae timber.

name: Sandalwood Log
desc: A rough-cut log of sandalwood timber.

name: White Oak Lumber
desc: Processed white oak lumber.

name: Miracle Apple Lumber
desc: Processed miracle apple lumber.

name: White Ash Lumber
desc: Processed white ash lumber.

name: Sandteak Lumber
desc: Processed sandteak lumber.

name: Lignum Vitae Lumber
desc: Processed lignum vitae lumber.

name: Sandalwood Lumber
desc: Processed sandalwood lumber.

name: Multifaceted Varnish
desc: A single coat of this all-in-one sealant, created in a collaborative effort by the Mean's various facets, can strengthen, protect, and polish any wooden surface to which it is applied.

name: Truegold Sand
desc: Bright sand that shines like the sun, consisting of tiny grains of truegold.

name: Truegold Ore
desc: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal truegold, both harder and more colorful than standard gold.

name: Bluespirit Ore
desc: A sizable hunk of the remarkably aether-rich mineral known as bluespirit.

name: Manasilver Sand
desc: Sand that moves almost as a liquid, consisting of tiny grains of manasilver.

name: Titancopper Sand
desc: Varicolored sand consisting of tiny grains of titanium and copper.

name: Titancopper Ore
desc: A decent-sized piece of rock containing a naturally occurring mixture of titanium and copper.

name: Dimythrite Sand
desc: Darkly glowing sand consisting of tiny grains of dimythrite.

name: Dimythrite Ore
desc: A decent-sized piece of rock containing what appears to be dimythrite.

name: Tungsten Ore
desc: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the metal tungsten.

name: Prismstone
desc: This peculiar type of stone shines with all the colors of the rainbow.

name: Deepgold Nugget
desc: A small nugget of impure deepgold.

name: Stonegold Nugget
desc: A small nugget of impure stonegold.

name: Deepgold Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted deepgold.

name: Stonegold Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted stonegold.

name: Manasilver Nugget
desc: A small nugget of impure manasilver.

name: Bluespirit Tile
desc: A thin slab of cut and polished bluespirit.

name: Titanbronze Nugget
desc: A small nugget of impure titanbronze alloy.

name: Titanbronze Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted titanbronze.

name: Dwarven Mythril Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted dwarven mythril.

name: Dwarven Mythril Nugget
desc: A small nugget of impure dwarven mythril.

name: Tungsten Steel Ingot
desc: An ingot of smelted tungsten steel.

name: Prismatic Ingot
desc: A thin slab of cut and polished prismstone.

name: Multifaceted Abrasive
desc: This all-in-one abrasive, created in a collaborative effort by the Mean's various facets, can be used to both sand metals and polish them to a lustrous sheen.

name: Multifaceted Resin
desc: This all-in-one resin, created in a collaborative effort by the Mean's various facets, can be used as either an adhesive or protective varnish as necessary.

name: Hematite
desc: A silver-black jewel.

name: Diaspore
desc: A light-green jewel.

name: Lazurite
desc: A clear blue jewel.

name: Triplite
desc: An amber jewel.

name: Petalite
desc: A whitish jewel.

name: Onyx
desc: A starkly black jewel.

name: Raw Hematite
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be hematite.

name: Raw Diaspore
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be diaspore.

name: Raw Lazurite
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be lazurite.

name: Raw Triplite
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be triplite.

name: Raw Petalite
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be petalite.

name: Raw Onyx
desc: An uncut, unpolished stone containing what appears to be onyx.

name: Smilodon Skin
desc: The sleek hide of a smilodon.

name: Green Glider Skin
desc: The glistening veridian hide of a glider.

name: Atrociraptor Skin
desc: The coarse hide of an atrociraptor.

name: Zonure Skin
desc: The resilient hide of a zonure.

name: Sea Swallow Skin
desc: The slippery hide of a sea swallow.

name: Chalicotherium Skin
desc: The short-haired hide of a giant odd-toed ungulate.

name: Smilodon Leather
desc: A large piece of cured smilodon skin.

name: Green Glider Leather
desc: A large piece of cured green glider skin.

name: Atrociraptor Leather
desc: A large piece of cured atrociraptor skin.

name: Zonure Leather
desc: A large piece of cured zonure skin.

name: Sea Swallow Leather
desc: A large piece of cured sea swallow skin.

name: Chalicotherium Leather
desc: A large piece of cured chalicotherium skin.

name: Multifaceted Alumen
desc: This all-in-one alumen, refined and modified in a collaborative effort by the Mean's various facets, is used to tan and deodorize hides.

name: Bright Linen Cloth
desc: Several yalms of undyed white fabric.

name: Bright Linen Yarn
desc: Sturdy yarn spun from bright linen.

name: Bright Flax
desc: This flowering plant, hardy enough to grow in harsh climes, has a stalk that can be used in the spinning of a naturally white yarn.

name: Iridescent Silk
desc: Not only does this fabric have a lustrous sheen, it also shimmers with hints of myriad colors.

name: Iridescent Silk Thread
desc: Shimmering thread spun from iridescent cocoons.

name: Iridescent Cocoon
desc: This worm-spun cocoon reflects a rainbow's worth of colors in the light.

name: Pixie Cotton
desc: A soft fabric woven from pixie floss.

name: Pixie Floss
desc: Unbelievably delicate cotton thread.

name: Pixie Floss Boll
desc: The brilliantly white flower of an unusual variety of cotton plant.

name: Ovim Wool
desc: Resilient fabric woven with the hair of the mountain-dwelling ovim.

name: Ovim Wool Yarn
desc: Coarse yarn spun from ovim fleece.

name: Ovim Fleece
desc: Long, lustrous hair shorn from an ovim.

name: Dwarven Cotton
desc: This thick-yet-supple variety of cotton is the traditional cloth of the dwarven people─which makes it the best cloth, as far as said people are concerned.

name: Dwarven Cotton Thread
desc: Versatile thread spun from dwarven cotton bolls.

name: Dwarven Cotton Boll
desc: Flowers of the coincidentally short-stalked dwarven cotton plant are used by the people bearing the same name to create everything from undergarments to beards.

name: Ethereal Silk
desc: This sheen of this oft-sought, rarely found silk is at once both foreign and familiar.

name: Ethereal Cocoon
desc: As difficult to lay hands upon as bubbles on the water, from these cocoons can be spun a rare type of silk.

name: Multifaceted Cotton Cloth
desc: This multi-purpose cloth, created through collaborative efforts by the Mean's various facets, is soft, supple, and durable.

name: Hoptrap Leaf
desc: The thin, twitching leaf of a hoptrap.

name: Silkmoth Scales
desc: The powdery scales of a silkmoth's wing.

name: Growth Formula Iota
desc: This alchemically formulated potation accelerates the growth of foliage.

name: Enchanted Truegold Ink
desc: Ink fortified with truegold sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

name: Grade 1 Strength Alkahest
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to strength, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 1 Dexterity Alkahest
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to dexterity, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 1 Vitality Alkahest
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to vitality, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 1 Intelligence Alkahest
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to intelligence, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 1 Mind Alkahest
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to mind, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Enchanted Manasilver Ink
desc: Ink fortified with manasilver sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

name: Vampire Cup Vine
desc: The thick, leathery vine of a vampire cup.

name: Vampire Vine Sap
desc: Sap harvested from the vampire vine─thankfully not the color of blood.

name: Starch Glue
desc: An adhesive substance created by boiling down assorted plant matter.

name: Extra Effervescent Water
desc: Naturally sparkling water bottled at the source. Do not shake before opening.

name: Refined Natron
desc: A pure white powder with no trace of impurity. Used in alchemy as a deodorizer and leavening agent.

name: Growth Formula Kappa
desc: This alchemically formulated potation accelerates the growth of foliage.

name: Sweet Alyssum
desc: This plant that blooms with myriad tiny flowers smelling of honey.

name: Fernleaf Lavender
desc: A fragrant herb with notched leaves.

name: Enchanted Dimythrite Ink
desc: Ink fortified with dimythrite sand to improve aetherial conductivity.

name: Underground Spring Water
desc: Clear, sweet water bottled at its subterranean source.

name: Lime Basil
desc: An herb that smells strongly of citrus.

name: Tiger Lily
desc: A variety of tall-growing lily, the bulbs of which can be used in various medicines.

name: Light Gerbera
desc: A type of gerbera named for its bright white flowers.

name: Grade 2 Strength Alkahest
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to strength, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to dexterity, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to vitality, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to intelligence, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Grade 2 Mind Alkahest
desc: When applied to items such as battle gear, this experimental alchemical liquid will dissolve away minute amounts of aether aspected to elements detrimental to mind, and by doing so, better attune the item and its wearer to the remaining beneficial elements.

name: Multifaceted Alchemic
desc: This alchemical concoction, created through collaborative efforts by the Mean's various facets, can be put to myriad uses─not all of them safe or recommended.

name: Lorikeet Down
desc: Soft plumes plucked from a lorikeet.

name: Island Wolf Fang
desc: A sharp canine tooth that once belonged to an island wolf.

name: Cubus Flesh
desc: Not only does this flesh have an unpleasant texture, it also smells horrendous.

name: Hydrozoan Umbrella
desc: The soft, gelatinous body of a hydrozoan.

name: Hard Mudstone
desc: A particularly dense stone comprised of layers of river silt compressed down over thousands of generations.

name: Hard Mudstone Whetstone
desc: A hard stone for sharpening tools made of metal or...less hard stone.

name: Volcanic Tuff
desc: Volcanic ash compacted by pressure and time into firm stone.

name: Tuff Whetstone
desc: A volcanic stone used for sharpening tools.

name: Chiaroglow Aethersand
desc: The coarse-grained, elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced matter.

name: Scuroglow Aethersand
desc: The coarse-grained, elementally aspected remnants of aetherially reduced matter.

name: Agedeep Aethersand
desc: The coarse-grained, elementally aspected remnants of highly concentrated aetherially reduced mineral matter.

name: Agewood Aethersand
desc: The coarse-grained, elementally aspected remnants of highly concentrated aetherially reduced mineral matter.

name: Ageflow Aethersand
desc: The coarse-grained, elementally aspected remnants of highly concentrated aetherially reduced mineral matter.

name: Yellow Alumen
desc: A more colorful version of the typically white mineral used by leatherworkers to tan animal hides.

name: Purple Carrot
desc: A dark purple root vegetable with a reddish stalk, differing somewhat in vitamin content from the orange carrot.

name: Harcot
desc: A particularly fragrant variety of apricot.

name: Frantoio
desc: This olive cultivar can be used to produce a large amount of high-quality cooking oil.

name: Amber Cloves
desc: This sweet spice made from the dried floral buds is used both as flavoring and in essential oils.

name: Russet Popoto
desc: An easy-to-peel variety of popoto with thin skin and a high starch content.

name: Curly Parsley
desc: This fancifully frilly parsley has an unobtrusive flavor that makes it perfect for use in otherwise bland dishes or as a garnish.

name: Garden Beet
desc: This common root vegetable doubles as a source of inexpensive sugar.

name: Blood Tomato
desc: The slight acidity of this bright tomato is guaranteed to whet one's appetite, making it a longstanding favorite of tavern owners throughout Norvrandt.

name: Royal Grapes
desc: The flavor of these cultivated grapes has been intensified using a special bacteria. Though unpleasant to eat whole, they are suitable for juicing and fermentation.

name: Night Pepper
desc: A dark aromatic spice used in cooking as well as pickling.

name: Mist Spinach
desc: A highly nutritious, deep-green vegetable.

name: Creamtop Mushroom
desc: A bulbous white mushroom that grows wild in forests.

name: Bomba Rice
desc: This short-grain rice is more absorbant than other varieties and does not clump together when cooked.

name: Pixie Apple
desc: A powerfully sweet variety of apple.

name: Upland Wheat
desc: This staple grain was grown at high elevation.

name: Broad Beans
desc: These large, spring green beans are easy to cultivate, and have served as a staple food for millennia.

name: Gianthive Chip
desc: A normal-sized piece of a massive hive created by a giant honey bee swarm.

name: Lemonette
desc: A tiny lemon replete with sour juice.

name: Peppermint
desc: This refreshing herb is suitable for use in cooking, essential oils, and tea.

name: Coffee Beans
desc: Beans that, with some effort, will become grounds suitable for brewing fragrant coffee.

name: Frantoio Oil
desc: Oil extracted from frantoio olives, suitable for cooking and certain medicinal concoctions.

name: Garden Beet Sugar
desc: A sweetener made by boiling down the juice extracted from garden beets.

name: Squid Ink
desc: This sticky, stygian liquid─decidedly an acquired taste─was harvested from a spearhead squid.

name: Upland Wheat Flour
desc: Finely milled upland wheat.

name: Golden Honey
desc: This shimmering, pure-gold honey comes courtesy of the giant honey bee.

name: Night Vinegar
desc: A high-quality distilled vinegar made from royal grapes.

name: King Salmon
desc: King salmon, able to reach more than twice the size of their cousins, are so scarce that only a select group of dedicated fishers have been granted permission to catch and keep them.

name: Robe Lettuce
desc: So named for its supposed resemblance to a faerie tale sorcerer's robes, this variety of lettuce grows at altitude and is known for its crisp leaves.

name: Kriollo Kukuru Bean
desc: This variety of kukuru bean is hard to cultivate, and therefore coveted by gourmands─regardless of how little difference to the taste of the end product it actually makes.

name: Pixieberry
desc: A dainty, capricious variety of fruit─one can never quite be sure whether any given berry will be mild, sweet, or tart.

name: Dzo Tenderloin
desc: A superior carving of meat from a carefully raised domestic dzo.

name: Sheep Casings
desc: Intestine casings for use in cooking.

name: Rail Tenderloin
desc: A lean piece of meat stripped from an island rail.

name: Lorikeet Egg
desc: The delicate egg of the rainbow lorikeet.

name: Ovim Meat
desc: A large, marbled slab of meat cut from the loin of a mountain-dwelling ovim.

name: Sausage Links
desc:
Though this is a surprisingly difficult dish to master, as the casings that hold in the rich blend of flavors can easily split during cooking, the resulting greasy, salty links are well worth the effort─particularly if said effort is someone else's.

name: Faded Copy of What Angel Wakes Me
desc: Timeworn pages of sheet music containing the full score for What Angel Wakes Me.

name: Faded Copy of Insanity
desc: Timeworn pages of sheet music containing the full score for Insanity.

name: Dancing Wing
desc: A gossamer fae wing, liberated from its owner in the Dancing Plague.

name: Immaculate Wingblade
desc: A lethal-looking piece of one of the Lightwarden Innocence's wings.

name: Fine Glass Fiber
desc: This incredibly thinly spun glass is well suited to enhancing water resistance.

name: Coarse Saltpeter
desc: A translucent crystalline substance often used in making glass, firesand, and dyes.

name: Crimson Firesand
desc: The use of coarse saltpeter makes this flammable powder slightly more volatile than normal firesand.

name: Highland Spring Water
desc: Mineral-rich water bottled at its high-elevation source.

name: Steer Hide
desc: A large piece of thick and durable steer hide.

name: Indigo Cloth
desc: This fabric makes clothing both durable and difficult to notice dirt and stains upon. ...Not that anyone is advising never washing your trousers, mind you.

name: Fireglass Leather
desc: A piece of cured leather with a sheen so glossy it's nearly reflective.

name: Enchanted Elm Lumber
desc: A cutting of wizened elm, processed into smooth lumber by magic.

name: Red Campanulas
desc:
A bunch of red campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

A bunch of blue campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

desc:
A bunch of yellow campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

desc:
A bunch of green campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Orange Campanulas
desc:
A bunch of orange campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Purple Campanulas
desc:
A bunch of purple campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

desc:
A bunch of white campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Black Campanulas
desc:
A bunch of black campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve their vibrant color.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Rainbow Campanulas
desc:
A bunch of multicolored campanulas, selectively fertilized to achieve a variety of vibrant colors.

Bouquets can be placed within select vases for display in estates.

name: Flyer Printing Materials
desc: Perhaps one day, these humble materials will fulfill their dream of being turned into flyers to advertise Eulmore's finest drinking and ogling establishment. With your help, this dream may very well come true.

name: Kholusian Cuisine Paraphernalia
desc: An artisan's touch is required to turn this hodgepodge into something the Beehive's kitchen staff can use to produce its reasonably priced and reasonably tasty fare.

name: Honeybee Trappings Materials
desc: As sparkly and fabulous as these assorted materials may be, they have a long way to go before they can be added to the costume worn by the Beehive's songstress.

name: Airship Fitting Materials
desc: Few could envision that these rather uninspiring objects will eventually be soaring gracefully through the skies. Strictly speaking, it will be the airship to which they are attached that will be doing the flying, but it still counts.

name: Beehive Souvenir Materials
desc: As anyone who has had the dubious pleasure of visiting a seaside tourist trap can attest, the majority of the souvenirs sold are made from cheap and readily available materials, often found washed up on the shore along with the driftwood and dead jellyfish. The contents of this bag are─as is tradition─of similar ilk, clearly indicated by the dried seaweed with which most of the items are covered.

name: Hades's Auracite
desc: A small chip of the auracite in which Hades was sealed. May you keep it close, and ever remember.

name: Alumina Whetstone
desc: A whestone carved from alumina. Used for sharpening metal or stone blades.

name: Pliable Glass Fiber
desc: This thinly spun glass is remarkably resistant to breakage, even when handled by a particularly clumsy craftsman.

name: Sandalwood Sap
desc: A partially congealed ball of sticky sap extracted from a sandalwood tree.

name: Beryllium Ore
desc: A decent-sized piece of rock containing the precious metal beryllium.

name: Sublime Solution
desc: Whatever it does, it does it sublimely.

name: Sweetmeat Mussel
desc:
A variety of mussel with coloring so stygian that it appears almost to have been steeped in shadow. A mussel of darkness, if you will.
...Become what you mussel.

name: Skybuilders' Yew Log
desc: The distinct lack of trees is one of many problems the first people to settle in Ishgard chose to ignore, making this otherwise commonplace material─sourced from the East Shroud─extremely valuable.

name: Skybuilders' Iron Ore
desc: While this may look much like any other iron ore found in middle La Noscea, there are subtle differences that only an expert in the field will recognize. The name, for one, is considerably longer.

name: Skybuilders' Fine Sand
desc: This sand gathered in central Thanalan is not only fine, but extremely well behaved, choosing to stay in one closely knit lump while jostling alongside the rest of your possessions.

name: Skybuilders' Hemp
desc: Though this hardy plant can grow almost anywhere, the snow-blasted precipices of Ishgard have so far proven too steep a challenge for it to overcome. This particular specimen was harvested in lower La Noscea, an environment far more conducive to plant life─or any sort of life, for that matter.

name: Skybuilders' Ash Log
desc: Ash! A-Ah! Savior of the Firmament!♪

name: Skybuilders' Rock Salt
desc: Although upper La Noscea seems rather a distant location from which to source something as simple as salt, the Ishgardians are nothing if not particular in their tastes.

name: Skybuilders' Electrum Ore
desc: The electrum ore found in upper La Noscea is believed to be far better suited to the skybuilders' needs than any other variety. Were anyone to ask them why, they would, in most cases be met with a response along the line of, “Because it just is.”

name: Skybuilders' Iron Sand
desc: The tradition of measuring powdered substances in units of “pinches” has been the cause of many arguments, largely due to differences in finger size between the various races. Folk in eastern Thanalan, where this sample was gathered, have been known to ask Lalafells to measure when selling, and Roegadyn when buying, for obvious reasons.

name: Skybuilders' Flax
desc: It is a well known fact among botanists that the flax in the South Shroud is superior to every other kind, for reasons far too complicated and boring for anyone else to care about.

name: Skybuilders' Spring Water
desc: Having only traveled the relatively short distance from the Coerthas central highlands to Ishgard, this spring water is still remarkably fresh, though the icy chill threatens to freeze it inside the bottle.

name: Skybuilders' Camphorwood Log
desc: Few members of the mortal races are equipped to make the perilous journey to the Churning Mists, and those who do normally hope to have more than a log or two to show for their troubles.

name: Skybuilders' Straw
desc: Why the skybuilders would specify that their straw be brought from the Dravanian forelands is anyone's guess. Perhaps the smell helps their chocobos sleep more peacefully?

name: Skybuilders' Hardsilver Ore
desc: The time spent mining this ore in the Dravanian hinterlands would perhaps have seemed less arduous if you had the faintest idea how the skybuilders plan to use it.

name: Skybuilders' Mythrite Sand
desc: You have a sneaking suspicion that you may have lost some of the sand during the return journey from the Sea of Clouds, though the amount you have in your possession should still suffice.

name: Skybuilders' Tea Leaves
desc: The thought of happy skybuilders drinking delicious tea was the only motivation you needed as you risked life and limb gathering these leaves in the Sea of Clouds.

name: Skybuilders' Dravanian Spring Water
desc: There are easier places to collect spring water than the Dravanian forelands, though it seems your personal safety is not especially high on the skybuilders' list of concerns.

name: Skybuilders' Urunday Log
desc: Compared to most places in Gyr Abania, the Peaks has more than its fair share of trees, so who would object to you taking a few logs? Bloodthirsty Qiqirn and rampaging ruud suuds, that's who. Or perhaps they just see you as an easy meal?

name: Skybuilders' Nightsteel Ore
desc: The Ruby Sea is not especially well known as a prime location for mining, though those who are nautically minded can uncover all sorts of rare and unique treasures. Whether the skybuilders choose to turn this into fine jewelry or something more mundane, like a tea strainer, remains to be seen.

name: Skybuilders' Adder
desc: Venomous snakes are something of a rarity in Ishgard, so the skybuilders have ordered that some be delivered from the Azim Steppe to help improve morale. Workers displaying a lack of enthusiasm will be given some time in “the pit” to rediscover their commitment to the cause.

name: Skybuilders' Molybdenum Ore
desc: While the Lochs are better known as a source of salt, the rich veins of ore are drawing in miners from far and wide.

name: Skybuilders' Horsetail
desc: Yanxia is rich in both flora and fauna, and horsetail forms a major part of the diet of many grazing creatures.

name: Skybuilders' Ruby Sea Water
desc: While water from the Ruby Sea may not sound particularly appealing, this was actually brought from a small freshwater spring on one of the surrounding islands. Drinking this is unlikely to result in life-threatening dehydration.

name: Skybuilders' Durium Sand
desc: A pinch of anything tends not to be an awful lot, though this particular sand from the Azim Steppe is apparently worth more than its weight in gold.

name: Skybuilders' Vine
desc: Quite why a particular type of vine that can only be found in the Azim Steppe is necessary to the skybuilders' plans has yet to be explained. Perhaps they are planning to surprise you with a work of surpassing genius? Or perhaps not.

name: Skybuilders' White Ash Log
desc: Obviously, none of the skybuilders has even heard of the Rak'tika Greatwood, though the specific qualities they seek in their timber can most easily be found in the white ash trees that grow there.

name: Skybuilders' Reef Rock
desc: If a porous rock from the bottom of the ocean is required in the rebuilding of Ishgard, then so be it. Your job is to mine, not question the reasoning behind such dubious demands.

name: Skybuilders' Truegold Ore
desc: Why submit a boring chunk of gold ore when you can bring one all the way from Il Mheg instead?

name: Skybuilders' Cotton Boll
desc: This cotton must be very special indeed for you to bring it all the way from Lakeland in the First. You can only hope that the skybuilders appreciate you going the extra malm. And traveling to another world.

name: Skybuilders' Dawn Lizard
desc: One day, this poor lizard is chasing other, smaller scurrying creatures across the desert plains of Amh Araeng, and the next, it is being transported to another world and dragged lashing and kicking to Ishgard. The chances of the cold-blooded scalekin being content in its frozen new surroundings are slim at best, and you can only hope that the skybuilders are grateful to you for supplying a miserable and motionless lizard.

name: Skybuilders' Wheat
desc: Were the other contributors to hear that you traveled to Amh Araeng in the First simply to procure wheat, they would think you are just trying to show off.

name: Skybuilders' Truegold Sand
desc: The isle of Kholusia is known by the inhabitants of Norvrandt to have the very finest of gold sand. Whether this is up to the impossibly high standards of the skybuilders will only become apparent when it is submitted for inspection.

name: Skybuilders' Highland Spring Water
desc: Any water gathered from Il Mheg is likely to have been enchanted by either the pixies or the Fuath, though that is a problem for the skybuilders, not you, to worry about.

name: Skybuilders' Resin
desc: Thankfully, the resin appears to have suffered no ill effects during your return from the Rak'tika Greatwood, meaning that it is still a gelatinous blob with seemingly no practical application whatsoever.

name: Faded Copy of Invincible
desc: Timeworn pages of sheet music containing the full score for Hades's theme, Invincible.

name: Shell Leather
desc: A particularly glossy and durable variety of leather, the production of which is no mean feat.

name: Skysteel Ingot
desc: The most advanced technology of the Skysteel Manufactory went into the creation of this block of metal. According to Biggs, equipment made from this material will allow its user to see around corners.

name: Skysteel Leather
desc: The most advanced technology of the Skysteel Manufactory went into the creation of this piece of leather. According to Biggs, equipment made from this material will allow its user to hear sounds before they are made.

name: Skysteel Cloth
desc: The most advanced technology of the Skysteel Manufactory went into the creation of this bolt of cloth. According to Biggs, equipment made from this material will allow its user to smell a person's thoughts from a malm away.

name: Skybuilders' Cocoon
desc: While there seems to be an endless supply of these in Yanxia, why anyone would actually want them is unclear. They have a taste to match their appearance, in other words, revolting.

name: Skybuilders' Sea Salt
desc: The ocean depths are dark and full of horrors... But also, rather a good location to harvest salt. Just watch out for the horrors.

name: Skybuilders' Toad
desc: What is worse than being born a toad? Being born a toad and then carried against your wishes from your home in western Thanalan to icy Ishgard, where if you don't freeze to death, are likely to be chopped up and boiled in a pot. That is what is worse. Much worse, in fact.
